issueDTO.title: Update deprecated kustomize API version from v1alpha1 to v1
issueDTO.description:
## Description

The kustomize component configuration file uses the deprecated API version `v1alpha1` which should be updated to the stable `v1` API to avoid warnings with kubectl version 1.27 or higher.

## File affected
`jupyter/pytorch/ubi9-python-3.12/kustomize/components/accelerator/kustomization.yaml`

## Required change
```diff
-apiVersion: kustomize.config.k8s.io/v1alpha1
+apiVersion: kustomize.config.k8s.io/v1
```

## Background
This issue was identified during code review and deferred for later implementation to avoid scope creep in the current PR.

## References
- PR: https://github.com/opendatahub-io/notebooks/pull/1230
- Comment: https://github.com/opendatahub-io/notebooks/pull/1230#discussion_r2175221335
- Requested by: @jiridanek

repository.name: notebooks

issueDTO.title: View crashed Pod logs (previous logs)
issueDTO.description:
When I am troubleshooting a Pod that has crashed or restarted, I want to be able to view the logs from its previous container instance, so I can understand what caused the failure and take corrective action.


With kubectl you can see the logs for a crashed Pod like this:

```shell
kubectl logs <pod-name> --previous
kubectl logs <pod-name> -c <container-name> --previous
```

API:
```
GET /api/v1/namespaces/{namespace}/pods/{pod}/log?previous=true
```

`previous=true`: fetches logs from the previous container instance, which is useful when the container has crashed or restarted.


We need to design and agree a UI before implementation:
- Maybe an option on the log viewer page?
- Or a separate action "View previous logs" button?



## Additional context

See:
- kubectl logs command reference: https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubectl/generated/kubectl_logs/
- Debugging running or crashing pods: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug/debug-application/debug-running-pod/
- Logging architecture overview (includes --previous usage): https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/cluster-administration/logging/
- For example yaml to make a Pod terminate "termination-demo" https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug/debug-application/determine-reason-pod-failure/

This was one of the most requested features in dashboard: https://github.com/kubernetes/dashboard/issues/1393 https://github.com/kubernetes/dashboard/pull/2392/files and is a commonly used feature of kubectl.

issueDTO.title: design brainstorm: widescreen / dashboard mode for large screens
issueDTO.description:
This will start as a research issue to gather ideas.

- It's common for teams to put up a large screen to be used as a dashboard.
- headlamp supports desktop/tablet/mobile views but not a large screen mode (4k is 3840x2160 pixels)

Some questions about what it could show?
- multiple resource lists at once in many columns? (mobile views all the way down?)
- should it be a special URL, or just be responsive?
- cycle through different views?
- 8k?, 4k HD Ultra, HD?
- ...



## Cluster home screen

See how there's lots of space at 4k resolution?

![cluster home screen at 4k high resolution](https://github.com/headlamp-k8s/headlamp/assets/9541/f86d678f-2718-47b7-9792-8e2cbda99fc3)


## List of resources

![headlamp at 4x resolution width](https://github.com/headlamp-k8s/headlamp/assets/9541/f27a1ebe-2694-4392-ac62-be363f1ebeba)

Implement a responsive grid layout using CSS Grid or Flexbox

issueDTO.title: Stories for components
issueDTO.description:
Each of the components inside Headlamp need [stories](https://storybook.js.org/) made for the different states.

- for easier manual UI testing, where the components are separate from the backend and each other.
- for automated regression testing of the presentational parts of the components

## Components that need stories

There's a number of components that still don't have any stories written for them.

Please write in the issue if you want to start on one, and then tick it off here when it's merged in.

- [ ] common/ReleaseNotes
- [x] components/App/Notifications
- [ ] components/App/Layout
- [ ] components/App/AppContainer
- [x] components/cluster/Charts
- [x] components/cluster/Chooser
- [x] components/cluster/ClusterChooser
- [ ] components/cluster/Overview

## Components that need stories improving

Some stories test only one possible state. These stories need improving.

How can you find these ones that need more states?

If you run make frontend-test from the root of the repo you'll see it prints out some code coverage.
`cd frontend && npm run test -- --coverage`

From that you could see if there's any more major code paths that might need covering with more story states.
(There's a html report in coverage/index.html as well with more details)


## Where should the stories go?

A good example to look at is `src/components/common/ActionButton`.

The preferred layout is the folder layout like this:

```
Component/Component.tsx, main place where the component goes. Named after the component.
Component/index.tsx, This should export things from Component.tsx
Component/Component.stories.tsx, contains the component shown in different states.
Component/__snapshots__ , where the story shot files are.
```

## Presentational VS container (logic) components

See [documentation here](link-to-story-js). In short, the logic should be separated so mainly the component can be tested without dependencies on other things. An example of logic that could be separated is API calls.

Some refactoring is probably needed to implement stories:

- to place components in a folder, with filenames the same name as the component
- to separate the presentational "pure" parts

## viewing the stories, and running the tests

To view the storybook:

```bash
cd frontend
npm install
npm run storybook
```

To run the tests, and generate the snapshot files (rendered html):

```bash
cd frontend
npm install # not needed if you've done it already.
npm run test -- --coverage
```

You can also run the tests without the interactive test runner like this:
```bash
CI=true npm run test -- --coverage
```

Hey! after reviewing the codebase I realized the Notifications story is already complete with multiple test cases.

issueDTO.title: Add SSMRunCommandOperator
issueDTO.description:
### Description

Amazon Systems Manager (SSM) is used by system admins to manage AWS resources like EC2. It also provided ability for companies to run scripts on the EC2 machines securely using it's RunCommand feature. Adding SSM RunCommand Operator to the Amazon provider package will unlock migration to Airflow from legacy job scheduling frameworks like AutoSys

### Use case/motivation

I work with a few customers that are in the process of migrating jobs from AutoSys and other legacy frameworks to Airflow. For these customers, a lot of their existing jobs are in shell scripts running on EC2. When they migrate to Airflow, they are looking for an easy way to lift those scripts and run on Airflow. SSHOperator could be an option for this but in many corporate environments, SSH is disabled for security reasons. One of the secure ways AWS recommends executing a remote script on EC2 is by using SSM RunCommand.

### Related issues

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit a PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

issueDTO.title: ✨ MLIR - Conversion from/to CUDA-Q's `quake` dialect
issueDTO.description:
### What's the problem this feature will solve?

Our efforts in adopting MLIR within the MQT have been steadily progressing.
#880 is the first PR that adds interoperability with an external framework, namely Xanadu's Catalyst and their `Quantum` dialect.
To connect the ecosystem further and to extend the compatibility of the MQT, this issue aims to add support for NVIDIA's `quake` dialect that is used within CUDA-Q. See https://github.com/NVIDIA/cuda-quantum/blob/main/Overview.md for a brief overview.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Similarly to the solution currently being pursued in #880, it should be possible to translate MLIR programs using the Quake dialect to our internal `mqtopt` or `mqtdyn` (see comment below for more details) dialect and back.
The conversion itself can probably borrow quite a few of the implementation details from #880.
The intriguing aspect is the packaging aspect in the sense that it is still an open question how to best add these translations without adding an unconditional dependency on cuda-q. Ideally, the integration is set up similar to how we currently handle Qiskit as an optional plugin of the mqt-core Python package: https://github.com/munich-quantum-toolkit/core/tree/main/src/mqt/core/plugins/qiskit
comments:
We currently have two MLIR dialects: `mqtopt` and `mqtdyn`. 
`mqtopt` uses value semantics, i.e. each operation "consumes" a quantum state and returns an updated state.
`mqtdyn` uses memory semantics. Here, each operation is performed on a reference to a qubit, similar to e.g. OpenQASM's `x q[0]`.

As Quake supports memory semantics (`!quake.ref`) *and* value semantics (`!quake.wire`), this makes conversions a bit more complex. We would rather not have a mix between `mqtopt` and `mqtdyn`, so the Quake operations should be converted to only one of the two dialects. I can see both of them making sense:

- *Convert to `mqtdyn`*: `!quake.ref` operations can be converted directly to `mqtdyn` qubits. For `!quake.wire` operations, search the reference it was originally pulled from through the `quake.unwrap` operation and use that information to translate the wire into a `mqtdyn` qubit.
- *Convert to `mqtopt`*: `!quake.wire` operations can be converted directly to `mqtopt` qubits and their corresponding `quake.wrap`/`quake.unwrap` calls roughly align with `mqtopt.extractQubit` and `mqtopt.insertQubit` calls. For `!quake.ref` operations, `mqtopt` qubits can be extracted from a register using `mqtopt.extractQubit`. Here, we have to keep track in detail what qubit comes from what `mqtopt`-register-index and from what `quake.ref` to make sure different operations do not interfere with each other.

Both approaches seem reasonable, but the first one (converting to `mqtdyn`) seems a bit simpler and may therefore be the better solution, intuitively.

summary.attemptedFixes: Converting Quake operations to only one of the two dialects (`mqtopt` or `mqtdyn`), possibly using `quake.unwrap` or `quake.wrap` operations.
summary.otherNotes: The conversion should borrow implementation details from #880. It's still an open question how to best add these translations without adding an unconditional dependency on cuda-q. The integration should be set up similar to how we currently handle Qiskit as an optional plugin of the mqt-core Python package.

issueDTO.title: Phone component
issueDTO.description:
Add a utility component for rendering phone numbers with formatting as an 'a' tag
For example:
998993303030
Would become:
+998(99)330-30-30
comments: @claude Propose an implementation plan

**Claude finished @diyor28's task** —— [View job](https://github.com/iota-uz/iota-sdk/actions/runs/16048039555) --- ### Phone Component Implementation Plan **Todo List:** - [x] Analyze current codebase structure and existing components - [x] Understand templ component patterns and organization - [x] Propose phone component implementation plan ## Analysis Results After analyzing the codebase, I found that **extensive phone number infrastructure already exists**: ### Existing Phone Infrastructure - **Phone Value Object**: `/modules/core/domain/value_objects/phone/phone.go` with E.164 conversion, validation, and country detection - **Country Code Mapping**: 254+ countries supported with area codes - **Input Components**: Tel input field and React phone input component - **Database Integration**: Phone fields throughout CRM, HRM, and Core modules ### Gap Identified The codebase **lacks display formatting utilities** - phone numbers are currently shown as raw E.164 strings (`+998993303030`) instead of user-friendly formatted display (`+998(99)330-30-30`). ## Implementation Plan ### 1. **Phone Display Formatting Utility** **Location**: `/modules/core/domain/value_objects/phone/formatter.go` **Functions to Add**: ```go // FormatForDisplay formats phone number for human-readable display func FormatForDisplay(phone Phone) string // FormatWithStyle formats phone number with specific style func FormatWithStyle(phone Phone, style DisplayStyle) string // DisplayStyle constants for different formatting styles type DisplayStyle int const ( StyleParentheses DisplayStyle = iota // +998(99)330-30-30 StyleDashes // +998-99-330-30-30 StyleSpaces // +998 99 330 30 30 ) ``` **Pattern Support**: - **Uzbekistan**: `+998(99)330-30-30` - **US**: `+1(555)123-4567` - **International**: `+44 20 7946 0958` - **Fallback**: Default spacing pattern for unsupported countries ### 2. **Templ Phone Component** **Location**: `/components/base/phone/phone.templ` **Component Structure**: ```go type Props struct { Phone string // Raw phone number Class string // CSS classes Style DisplayStyle // Formatting style ShowIcon bool // Show phone icon Attrs templ.Attributes } templ Link(props Props) { if props.ShowIcon { @icons.Phone(icons.Props{Size: "16"}) } { formatPhoneForDisplay(props.Phone, props.Style) } } ``` ### 3. **Component Integration** **Usage Example**: ```go // In templates @phone.Link(phone.Props{ Phone: client.Phone, Class: "text-blue-600 hover:underline", Style: phone.StyleParentheses, ShowIcon: true, }) ``` ### 4. **Files to Create/Modify** **New Files**: - `/modules/core/domain/value_objects/phone/formatter.go` - Display formatting logic - `/modules/core/domain/value_objects/phone/formatter_test.go` - Test coverage - `/components/base/phone/phone.templ` - Phone display component - `/components/base/phone/phone_templ.go` - Generated templ file **Modified Files**: - Update existing templates to use the new phone component - Add phone component to component registry if needed ### 5. **Testing Strategy** - **Unit Tests**: Format validation for different countries - **Integration Tests**: Component rendering with various props - **Template Tests**: Verify anchor tag generation and tel: links ### 6. **Benefits** - **Leverages Existing Infrastructure**: Uses current phone value object and country detection - **Consistent Formatting**: Centralized formatting logic across all templates - **Accessibility**: Proper tel: links for mobile devices - **Extensible**: Easy to add new formatting styles - **Type Safe**: Follows Go and templ best practices This implementation provides a complete phone display component that transforms raw phone numbers into user-friendly, clickable links while maintaining the existing robust phone number infrastructure. **Implementation Status**: ✅ **Plan Complete** - Ready for development
@claude Great, now implement it and don't forget to add tests

**Claude finished @diyor28's task** —— [View job](https://github.com/iota-uz/iota-sdk/actions/runs/16048597624) • [`claude/issue-321-20250703_105909`](https://github.com/iota-uz/iota-sdk/tree/claude/issue-321-20250703_105909) • [Create PR ➔](https://github.com/iota-uz/iota-sdk/compare/main...claude/issue-321-20250703_105909?quick_pull=1&title=feat%3A%20add%20phone%20component%20with%20display%20formatting%20utility&body=Add%20a%20utility%20component%20for%20rendering%20phone%20numbers%20with%20formatting%20as%20clickable%20links.%0A%0A%23%23%20Features%0A-%20Phone%20formatter%20utility%20with%20support%20for%207%20countries%0A-%203%20display%20styles%3A%20parentheses%2C%20dashes%2C%20spaces%0A-%20Templ%20phone%20component%20with%20Link%20and%20Text%20variants%0A-%20Comprehensive%20test%20coverage%20%2850%2B%20test%20cases%29%0A-%20Optional%20phone%20icon%20display%0A-%20Mobile-friendly%20tel%3A%20links%0A%0A%23%23%20Example%0ATransforms%20%60998993303030%60%20%E2%86%92%20%60%2B998%2899%29330-30-30%60%0A%0ACloses%20%23321%0A%0AGenerated%20with%20%5BClaude%20Code%5D%28https%3A//claude.ai/code%29)

---
### Phone Component Implementation Complete ✅

**Todo List:**
- [x] Analyze existing phone value object structure
- [x] Implement phone display formatter utility
- [x] Create templ phone component
- [x] Add comprehensive tests for formatter
- [x] Add tests for component
- [x] Run build commands and validate
- [x] Commit changes to branch

### 📋 **Implementation Summary**

Successfully implemented a comprehensive phone component with display formatting utilities:

#### **🔧 Core Features**
- **Phone Formatter Utility** (`formatter.go`): Format phone numbers for human-readable display
- **7 Country Support**: Uzbekistan, US/Canada, UK, Germany, France, Russia, plus default fallback
- **3 Display Styles**: Parentheses `+998(99)330-30-30`, Dashes `+998-99-330-30-30`, Spaces `+998 99 330 30 30`
- **Templ Components**: `Link` component (clickable tel: links) and `Text` component (display only)
- **Optional Icons**: Phone icon support using existing icon system
- **Mobile-Friendly**: Generates proper `tel:` links for mobile device integration

#### **📱 Usage Examples**
```go
// Clickable phone link with icon
@phone.Link(phone.Props{
    Phone: "+998993303030",
    Class: "text-blue-600 hover:underline",
    Style: phone.StyleParentheses,
    ShowIcon: true,
})

// Display-only phone text
@phone.Text(phone.Props{
    Phone: "+14155551234",
    Style: phone.StyleDashes,
})

// Direct formatting
formatted := phone.FormatString("+998993303030") // Returns: +998(99)330-30-30
```

#### **✅ Quality Assurance**
- **50+ Test Cases**: Comprehensive test coverage for all formatting scenarios
- **Build Validation**: All tests passing, no lint errors
- **Type Safety**: Full Go typing with proper error handling
- **Component Testing**: HTML generation, attributes, and icon rendering verified

#### **📁 Files Created**
- `modules/core/domain/value_objects/phone/formatter.go` - Formatting logic
- `modules/core/domain/value_objects/phone/formatter_test.go` - Formatter tests
- `components/base/phone/phone.templ` - Phone display components
- `components/base/phone/phone_test.go` - Component tests
- `components/base/phone/phone_templ.go` - Generated templ code

**Commit**: `49483b2` - All changes pushed to branch `claude/issue-321-20250703_105909`

issueDTO.title: [BUG] SECURITY: hertzbeat uses bouncycastle jars that have multiple CVEs
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

BouncyCastle no longer ship jdk15on jars. Projects should use the jdk18on ones instead.
The jdk15on jars were for Java 1.5 users and fixes that have been made to the jdk18on jars (Java 1.8 compatible) have not been backported - including security fixes.

The last Hertzbeat RC had bcprov-jdk15on-1.69.jar

* https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.bouncycastle/bcprov-jdk15on/1.69
* https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.bouncycastle/bcprov-jdk18on (1.81 current latest)

The classe names and packages are the same.

### Expected Behavior

_No response_

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Environment

```markdown
HertzBeat version(s):
```

### Debug logs

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

issueDTO.title: FrontEnd: Refine UI of the AutoEDA WebApp
issueDTO.description:
### 1. Create a Transparent Navbar with Smooth Scrolling
Description:
Build a transparent and responsive navbar using React + Vite. The navbar should include links to the following sections on the landing page:
  a) About
  b) How It Works
  c) CSV Upload

Each link should smoothly scroll to its corresponding section on the same page.

### 2. Create Landing Page with AutoEDA Introduction
Description:
Design a visually appealing React+ Vite landing page that introduces the purpose of AutoEDA. Include a headline, and a subheadline. Implement animations to look more techy.

### 3. Add File Upload UI for CSV Files
Description:
Implement a drag-and-drop file upload area (with a fallback button). Ensure only .csv files are accepted, and show the filename once a file is selected.

### 4. Display Success Message After File Upload
Description:
After a CSV file is uploaded, display a success toast or modal with a confirmation message. Also include basic feedback for invalid file formats.

**Advice:-**

1. Use TailwindCSS, ShadCN UI, Material UI, or similar for a clean and impactful design.
2. You are encouraged to use vector illustrations or subtle animations to enhance user experience and engagement.

issueDTO.title: Support automatically opening with com.epicgames.launcher://store links
issueDTO.description:
### Problem description

Hey :wave: 

Epic is famous for giving free games every now and then, and I have a Discord bot that alerts me whenever there's a new one available, including a link to the game in question, which on windows opens the epic client on the page of the game.

E.g.: Currently the free game is https://store.epicgames.com/p/melvor-idle-b6a9b3, and its link to open on the epic client is com.epicgames.launcher://store/p/melvor-idle-b6a9b3, so the `melvor-idle-b6a9b3` is the important part here, which indicates the game to go to.

On linux with the heroic games launcher, it just opens firefox `com.epicgames.launcher://store/p/melvor-idle-b6a9b3`, but obviously firefox doesn't know what to do with it. 

### Feature description

Would it be possible to have the same behaviour from the epic games client on the heroic client, opening the game on the store page? Would be very handy for those cases :smile: 

### Alternatives

_No response_

### Additional information

This is a duplicate of https://github.com/Heroic-Games-Launcher/HeroicGamesLauncher/issues/918, which unfortunately was closed by the author

issueDTO.title: feat: add SHA-512 hash support for SBOM formats (CycloneDX and SPDX)
issueDTO.description:
## Description

This is a feature request to add SHA-512 hash algorithm support to Trivy's SBOM parsing capabilities. Currently, Trivy only supports SHA-1, SHA-256, and MD5 hash algorithms when processing SBOM files.

Some tools, particularly NPM's SBOM generation (`npm sbom`), use SHA-512 hashes for package integrity verification. Adding SHA-512 support would enable Trivy to fully process these SBOMs and preserve important security metadata.

### Current limitations:
- **CycloneDX**: SHA-512 hashes are ignored and the hashes field becomes `null`
- **SPDX**: SHA-512 checksums are completely omitted from the output


## Current Behavior

### CycloneDX
In `pkg/sbom/cyclonedx/unmarshal.go:251-268`, the `unmarshalHashes` function only supports:
- SHA1
- SHA256
- MD5

Any other algorithm (including SHA-512) logs a warning but still creates a digest with an empty algorithm prefix (e.g., `:hashvalue` instead of `sha512:hashvalue`), resulting in malformed digest strings.

### SPDX
In `pkg/sbom/spdx/marshal.go:501-522`, the `spdxChecksums` function has the same limitation, returning `nil` for unsupported algorithms.

## Root Cause

The limitation stems from `pkg/digest/digest.go` which only defines three algorithms:
```go
const (
    SHA1   Algorithm = "sha1"
    SHA256 Algorithm = "sha256"
    MD5    Algorithm = "md5"
)
```

## Desired Behavior

Trivy should support SHA-512 hash algorithm alongside the existing SHA-1, SHA-256, and MD5 support. This would enable Trivy to:
- Preserve SHA-512 hashes when processing SBOMs from NPM and other tools
- Generate SBOMs with SHA-512 hashes when appropriate
- Maintain full compatibility with CycloneDX and SPDX specifications


## Impact

- Loss of package integrity verification data
- Generated SBOMs may be invalid or incomplete
- Affects tools that rely on SHA-512 for security validation

## Proposed Solution

1. Add SHA512 constant to `pkg/digest/digest.go`:
   ```go
   const (
       SHA1   Algorithm = "sha1"
       SHA256 Algorithm = "sha256"
       SHA512 Algorithm = "sha512"
       MD5    Algorithm = "md5"
   )
   ```

2. Add SHA-512 calculation support in the digest package

3. Update `unmarshalHashes` in CycloneDX:
   ```go
   case cdx.HashAlgoSHA512:
       alg = digest.SHA512
   ```

4. Update `spdxChecksums` in SPDX:
   ```go
   case digest.SHA512:
       alg = spdx.SHA512
   ```

## References

- NPM SBOM documentation: https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v10/commands/npm-sbom
- CycloneDX hash algorithm specification: https://cyclonedx.org/docs/1.6/json/#components_items_hashes
- SPDX checksum specification: https://spdx.github.io/spdx-spec/v2.3/package-information/#79-package-checksum-field

## Test Data

### CycloneDX Example
```json
{
  "$schema": "http://cyclonedx.org/schema/bom-1.5.schema.json",
  "bomFormat": "CycloneDX",
  "specVersion": "1.5",
  "components": [
    {
      "bom-ref": "lodash@4.17.21",
      "type": "library",
      "name": "lodash",
      "version": "4.17.21",
      "hashes": [
        {
          "alg": "SHA-512",
          "content": "bf690311ee7b95e713ba568322e3533f2dd1cb880b189e99d4edef13592b81764daec43e2c54c61d5c558dc5cfb35ecb85b65519e74026ff17675b6f8f916f4a"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

### SPDX Example
```json
{
  "spdxVersion": "SPDX-2.3",
  "packages": [
    {
      "name": "lodash",
      "SPDXID": "SPDXRef-Package-lodash-4.17.21",
      "checksums": [
        {
          "algorithm": "SHA512",
          "checksumValue": "bf690311ee7b95e713ba568322e3533f2dd1cb880b189e99d4edef13592b81764daec43e2c54c61d5c558dc5cfb35ecb85b65519e74026ff17675b6f8f916f4a"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

### Discussed in https://github.com/aquasecurity/trivy/discussions/9082

issueDTO.title: For avatars that don't load, reuse muted-user placeholder?
issueDTO.description:
For #296, we'll add a simple "person"-icon placeholder for an avatar image, to use when the user is muted.

Perhaps we could reuse this for when the real avatar doesn't load, either because the URL is invalid or, with `RealmContentNetworkImage.errorBuilder`, because its request fails (an instance of #265). Or, pre-#1556, for a message from an unknown sender (but we should eventually do #1556 for that).

This won't be ripe to work on until #296 is resolved. Please don't try to claim this issue if #296 is still open.

https://github.com/huggingface/dataset-viewer/blob/4859100ef282dcf73257dfb60e6b5a20d5955c68/jobs/cache_maintenance/tests/utils.py#L41

Hi @severo — I’d like to pick this up.

Now that `huggingface_hub>=0.25.0` supports the `gated` parameter in `HfApi.update_repo_settings`, I’ll remove the custom implementations in the following test files:

- `jobs/cache_maintenance/tests/utils.py`
- `services/admin/tests/fixtures/hub.py`
- `services/worker/tests/fixtures/hub.py`

Each call to `update_repo_settings(...)` will be replaced with the official method, and the custom functions will be removed. Let me know if that sounds good!

issueDTO.title: Instant meeting outside of dashboard?
issueDTO.description:
<!--- Please keep this note for other contributors -->

### How to use GitHub

* Please use the 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are interested into the same feature.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

---

## Feature request

Maybe this was already discussed during the dashboard design, but I couldn't find it.

With the new dashboard we have now "Start meeting", which allows us to create an "instant meeting", that is automatically deleted after 1 day by default. This option is _only_ available on the dashboard. So to start an instant meeting while in a conversation, one first has to drop to the dashboard to then create the meeting. (and understand, that the option is only there)

I think we should consider adding this option to the "add" menu as well, so it is reachable even outside the dashboard.
comments: Yes, it's planned

issueDTO.title: Airflow Databricks Operator Task Group Launch Task Not Properly Waiting for Upstream Tasks
issueDTO.description: ### Apache Airflow Provider(s) databricks ### Versions of Apache Airflow Providers 7.3.2 ### Apache Airflow version 2.10.3 ### Operating System managed airflow ### Deployment Docker-Compose ### Deployment details _No response_ ### What happened When using DatabricksWorkflowTaskGroups, a launch task is created. This launch task can be set to have upstream dependencies, however no matter what the launch task will not wait on any dependencies to execute, executing as soon as the dag run starts. This keeps us from using any parameters defined as part of a task that is intended to run before the task group initializes, for example setting parameters in the task group definition. ### What you think should happen instead This task should instead wait on prior tasks to finish as aligned with the trigger_rule assigned to that specific task. As the trigger_rule by default for the launch task is set to all_success, the task should NOT run until all upstream dependencies have finished. ### How to reproduce ```from airflow.models import DAG from airflow.operators.dummy import DummyOperator from airflow.providers.databricks.operators.databricks_workflow import ( DatabricksWorkflowTaskGroup, ) with DAG( dag_id="example_dag", schedule_interval=f"0 0 * * *", ) as dag: start_task = DummyOperator(task_id="end", trigger_rule="none_failed") task_group = DatabricksWorkflowTaskGroup( group_id="tg", databricks_conn_id="FILL IN DBX CONNECTION ID", job_clusters={ "job_cluster_key": "test_cluster", "new_cluster": { "cluster_name": "", "spark_version": "15.4.x-scala2.12", "node_type_id": "r4.2xlarge", "num_workers": 1, "autoscale": {"min_workers": 2, "max_workers": 8}, "aws_attributes": { "availability": "SPOT_WITH_FALLBACK", "ebs_volume_count": 1, "ebs_volume_size": 100, "ebs_volume_type": "GENERAL_PURPOSE_SSD", "first_on_demand": 1, "spot_bid_price_percent": 100, "zone_id": "auto", }, }, }, ) with task_group: pass ``` ### Anything else _No response_ ### Are you willing to submit PR? - [x] Yes I am willing to submit a PR! ### Code of Conduct - [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

issueDTO.title: [MCP] Pinterest
issueDTO.description:
## 🧩 Product Overview  

Pinterest is a visual discovery engine for finding ideas like recipes, home and style inspiration, and more.
This integration allows AI agents and workflows to create, manage, and interact with Pins and Boards, automating content sharing and curation.

---

## ⚠️ Important Note for Contributors  

To ensure consistency and maintainability, this feature must be submitted as a [Piece](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/piece-definition) following the Activepieces architecture. Submissions that do not follow this format will not be accepted. Please make sure to review the [Piece Development Guidelines](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview) before starting development.

---

## 🚨 Triggers  

| **Trigger** | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **New Pin on Board** | Fires when a new Pin is added to a specific board.|
|**New Follower**| Triggers when a user gains a new follower.|
|**New Board**| Fires when a new board is created in the account.|

---

## 🛠️ Write Actions   

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case**                                                                                                                                     |
|:------------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Create Pin** | Upload an image or video to create a new Pin on a board.|
|**Create Board**|Create a new Pinterest board for organizing Pins.|
|**Update Board**| Modify a board’s name, description, or visibility settings.|
|**Delete Pin**| Permanently delete a specific Pin. |

---

## 🔍 Search Actions

| **Trigger** | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **Find Pin by Title/Keyword** | Search for Pins using a title, description, or tag.|
|**Find Board by Name**| Locate a board by its name for pinning or updates.|

---

## 📚 API Reference  
- [Official Pinterest API Documentation](https://developers.pinterest.com/docs/api/v5/)

---

## 🧪 Test Account Access  
You can test Pinterest APIs by registering your app on the [Pinterest Developers Portal](https://developers.pinterest.com/)  and generating OAuth tokens.


---

## 🧑‍💻 New to Activepieces?

Activepieces is the leading open source AI automation platform. We have many apps (we call them Pieces), that are available within the builder and as MCPs. These apps are built with our TypeScript framework and are easy to develop. Once merged into our repository, they become available as pieces in our automation builder and as MCPs usable by AI agents and MCP clients.

Start building here: [Piece Development Docs](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview)
|

issueDTO.title: Title: Error When Using Multiple DataSets as Triggers in Apache AirFlow
issueDTO.description:
### Apache Airflow version

2.8.0

### If "Other Airflow 2 version" selected, which one?

_No response_

### What happened?

When using two or more DataSets as triggers, an error occurs while accessing the `source_task_instance` object of `DatasetEvent`.

### What you think should happen instead?

It should be possible to access all fields of every `DatasetEvent`.

### How to reproduce

Create two test DAGs (producer and consumer) and link them with two DataSets.
Code:
```python
from __future__ import annotations

from datetime import datetime

from airflow.datasets import Dataset
from airflow.decorators import task, dag

testDataSet = Dataset('/test')
testDataSet2 = Dataset('/test2')


@dag(
    dag_id='dag_producer',
    schedule=None,
    start_date=datetime(2021, 1, 1),
    catchup=False,
)
def dag_producer():
    @task(outlets=[testDataSet, testDataSet2])
    def test():
        return 'OK'

    test()


@dag(
    dag_id="dag_consumer",
    schedule=[testDataSet, testDataSet2],
    start_date=datetime(2021, 1, 1),
    catchup=False,

)
def dag_consumer():
    @task
    def print_triggering_dataset_events(triggering_dataset_events=None):
        for dataset, dataset_list in triggering_dataset_events.items():
            for dataset_event in dataset_list:
                print('Task result: ', dataset_event.source_task_instance.xcom_pull(task_ids='test'))

    print_triggering_dataset_events()


dag_consumer()
dag_producer()

repository.description: Apache Airflow - A platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows
repository.name: airflow

summary.main: Error When Using Multiple DataSets as Triggers in Apache Airflow: Accessing source_task_instance object of DatasetEvent results in detached instance error when trying to access xcom_pull method.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to access the source_task_instance object of DatasetEvent when using multiple DataSets as triggers in Apache Airflow. The issue is related to the detached instance error when trying to access the xcom_pull method.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue has been observed to happen after xcom_pull is called. Collecting source_task_instances first and then calling xcom_pull seems to work without any issue. A manual session creation can also be used as a workaround.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to accessing the source_task_instance object of DatasetEvent when using multiple DataSets as triggers in Apache Airflow. The problem occurs when trying to access the xcom_pull method of the source_task_instance object, resulting in a detached instance error. The workaround is to manually create a session before accessing the xcom_pull method.

## 🧩 Product Overview  

Checkout.com is a global payments platform enabling powerful automation around transactions, payouts, customers, and hosted payment links.

---

## ⚠️ Important Note for Contributors  

To ensure consistency and maintainability, this feature must be submitted as a [Piece](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/piece-definition) following the Activepieces architecture. Submissions that do not follow this format will not be accepted. Please make sure to review the [Piece Development Guidelines](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview) before starting development.

---

|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **Payment Events** | Trigger order fulfillment when payment is approved.|
|**Dispute Events**|Notify operations upon dispute opening or resolution.|

---

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **Create Customer** | Store new vault customer with email/name/phone/metadata.|
| **Update Customer** |  Update existing customer or their metadata.|
|**Create Payment Link**|Send payment link via email or SMS to a client.|
|**Create Payout**| Transfer merchant earnings.|
|**Refund a Payment**|Issue a refund (full or partial) for a captured payment.|

---

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case**                                                                                                                                     |

issueDTO.title: Add concepts from ENISA SotA Tech/Org Measures
issueDTO.description:
ENISA has published a Guideline on State of the art for Technical and Organisational measures. Georg/Signatu have proposed these be integrated into DPV's TOMs concepts - see [email with attached document](https://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-dpvcg/2023Nov/0002.html).

1. [harsh's reply](https://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-dpvcg/2023Nov/0007.html) with overview analysis of document and proposals for concepts in TOMs, RISK, and standards sections.
2. https://www.enisa.europa.eu/topics/cybersecurity-policy/nis-directive-new/minimum-security-measures-for-operators-of-essentials-services - tool showing mapping between measures from ISO 27001, NIST CSF, and ISA/IEC 62443
3. https://www.enisa.europa.eu/topics/cybersecurity-policy/nis-directive-new - measures for NIS2 directive implementations
comments:
The attached document details the 48 NIS2V Terms, where there was no match to DPV. 
These are from both the ISO27001 controls and the ENISA Minimum Security Measures for Operators of Essentials Services.
Any questions, please let me know.

[NIS2V Terms - Jenni Parry.xlsx](https://github.com/w3c/dpv/files/15232754/NIS2V.Terms.-.Jenni.Parry.xlsx)
@Jenni0608 thanks for sharing. Would `dpv:Policy` be a broad match for something like Policy on risk etc. in these terms?

Maybe for two of them (Control 5.1 & A.5.4) but looking at the definitions its nearly too broad: DPV Policy Definition - A guidance document outlining any of: procedures, plans, principles, decisions, intent, or protocols.
Versus control: Management shall require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures of the organisation.

Maybe that's because DPV doesn't model _controls_ but the _concept_ representing the control (more accurately the information) e.g. procedure to apply/enforce policy vs policy itself? If so, then the matching process should check/include the concept for information, and state that it doesn't accurately reflect the intended control i.e. an action or procedure?

issueDTO.title: [docs-bug]: Navigation buttons out of logical order on documentation pages
issueDTO.description:
### Problem: What is happening?

Currently, the navigation buttons in the "Projects" section of the documentation are not following a logical sequence.
For example, at the end of the “Add a Project” page, the "Next" button does not follow the expected reading flow for this section.
Ideally, after learning how to create a project, the user should be directed to the “View Project” page, continuing the logical progression of the process.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ce37121d-8d7e-42e5-938d-376682f04cd3)


### Expected behavior

The “Next” button should lead to the page “View a project”



The same issue occurs on the “List Projects” page, where the recommended setup would be to organize the navigation buttons as follows, respecting a logical reading sequence:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8540b274-432f-4b9d-9965-fb8736db2112)


On the “View a Project” page, the "Next" button could direct the user to the “Add an Environment” section.
This transition makes sense within the platform's logic, as after creating and viewing a project, the natural next step is to configure an environment within it.
This way, the user understands that they can now start structuring the resources and services related to that project, maintaining a continuous and intuitive workflow.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b05753cd-b5cf-4fab-b1ae-cdb187c820f9)

### Steps to reproduce

1 - Access the documentation at:
devopness.com/docs

2 - Navigate to the following section:
projects/add-project

3 - Make sure the "Previous" and "Next" navigation buttons follow the logical reading order.

📌 Suggestion summary:
Fix the navigation button links in the Projects section so they follow the logical reading flow of the section.



### Which Devopness module(s) are the source of the bug?

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: Email verification input text field should not be multiline on login screen
issueDTO.description:
### Summary

At the login screen, sometimes we need to enter a verification code received by email, likely when we sign up on a new device. This email verification input field appears after providing the correct username and password. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Freshly install the Commons App
2. Open the app and try to log in with your username and password
3. An email verification input field should appear
4. Make sure email verification input field is focused
5. Tap on the `Enter` button in the software keyboard of Android

### Expected behaviour

The **IME Action** for the email verification input field should be either `Done` or `Go`. Also, the input field's height shouldn't increase when pressing the `Enter` button.

### Actual behaviour

The `Enter` **IME Action** is displayed in the Android's soft keyboard, and tapping that increases the input field's height.

### Device name

Pixel 6

### Android version

Android 14

### Commons app version

Main Branch

### Device logs

_No response_

### Screen-shots

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e7177768-7721-405e-a838-90b12a1a6a9c

Prefer not

issueDTO.title: Update in progress button state for consistency
issueDTO.description: ## Feature Description When a button has a related "in progress" state such as a navigation or background request, we don't always handle this consistently. This is similar to #10281 but specific to the appearance. For example, when saving settings [we include an ellipsis](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/8f1c16bb71bcf5091bc5b56d535e03973d4b9b36/assets/js/components/settings/SettingsActiveModule/Footer.js#L153-L155), but in nearly all other similar buttons we do not. --------------- _Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._ ## Acceptance criteria * When module settings are being saved, after CTA has been clicked and CTA enters in progress state, only spinner icon should be showing, text shouldn't be changing to the `Saving` and ellipsis should not show `...` ## Implementation Brief * [x] Update `assets/js/components/settings/SettingsActiveModule/FooterPrimaryAction.js` * Remove https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/4946f1a5df79dfac2ac8f94c6a03283a163241a1/assets/js/components/settings/SettingsActiveModule/FooterPrimaryAction.js#L75 and conditional wrapper around it. * Spinner is already integrated, so no further change is needed ### Test Coverage * No updates expected ## QA Brief 1. Open any module's settings in `Site Kit > Settings`. 2. Make any changes to the module, when the settings are being saved, the button text should stay as `Confirm changes` and not `Saving...`. Refer attached screenshots. #### Before #### Latest change ## Changelog entry *
comments: I have reached out to @sigal-teller and @marrrmarrr in Slack about how best to handle this, [see Slack conversation here](https://fueled10up.slack.com/archives/C01CA828ZPZ/p1741178336319719).
Based on the thread in the slack referenced in previous comment - buttons should keep the spinner only, and legacy elipsis/text change should be removed
@zutigrm this shouldn't be only specific for module settings. We need to do it for all progress button across our codebase to make sure we have consistent approach everywhere.

Thanks @eugene-manuilov, I know AC is more module settings centric, but it's because we do not have this occurrence anywhere else in our codebase, this is the only place we need to remove/update it. All other buttons use spinner without ellipsis
Ah, thanks for clarifying it, @zutigrm. AC ✔
IB ✅

issueDTO.title: [RFE]: Provide dev contribution guide for Mac OS system
issueDTO.description:
## Current situation
Mac OS runs zsh and the makefile of the project fails to execute certain commands on MAC Os.
Ex: `cd backend && ./tools/check_pkg_test.sh`
One can try to apply some hacks over the file to run the project manually.
But if option comes from upstream it will be something trustworthy.
Makefile of the project acc

## Impact

MAC Os users will be able to contribute.
comments:
I was trying to set up development environment by following the [guide](https://kinvolk.io/docs/nebraska/latest/development/)
on Mac Os Intel System.

Running Node JS: 10/12 (Tried on Both)

1. Issues in smoothly executing Makefile.
2.  `make run-backend`  fails with ```lags "-static"" -o bin/nebraska ./cmd/nebraska
./bin/nebraska -auth-mode noop
make: ./bin/nebraska: No such file or directory``` , I made my workaround over this by manually running this file and able to start the server.
3. `make run-frontend` executes and starts the server  but getting CORS ``` Error: A cross-origin error was thrown. React doesn't have access to the actual error object in development. See https://fb.me/react-crossorigin-error for more information.``` . I am not sure if this is happening because of something specific to OS.

4. On executing `check_pkg_test.sh` : mapfile: command not found
Not sure if this project is meant to support development on MAC OS. If that's not the case then we can close the issue.

Update on Testing with on Fedora:

1. No issues in make run-backend for the first run. (As expected cause Fedora runs Bash)
2. make run-frontend . (No issues again on the command) But still facing 
```
CORS Error: A cross-origin error was thrown. React doesn't have access to the actual error object in development. See https://fb.me/react-crossorigin-error for more information.
```
had similar issue running `make` (very first step) on mac m1. Has this been resolved?
@ervcz This is still valid and could probably use some work if we wanted to throw a `help-wanted` tag on this.

Hi! I've tried to analyze the macOS compatibility issues in the Nebraska development scripts and I would like to point out thefollowing potential problems:

1. **Bash version incompatibility**:
  - `backend/tools/check_pkg_test.sh` uses `mapfile` (line 11), which was introduced in bash 4.0
  - [macOS ships with bash 3.2 because they have licensing problems](https://discussions.apple.com/thread/255353799?answerId=259964001022&sortBy=rank#259964001022)

2. **GNU vs BSD utilities**:
  - `backend/tools/setup_local_db.sh` and `backend/tools/run-all.sh` use GNU getopt with `--longoptions`
  - macOS ships with BSD getopt which doesn't support long options like `--longoptions`
  - This is a fundamental difference between BSD and GNU implementations

3. **There might be other similar compatibility issues, e.g. in**:
  - backend/tools/run-all.sh - uses GNU getopt with long options and bash arrays

### Potential fix for check_pkg_test.sh

Replace lines 10-11:
```bash
output_lines=()
mapfile -t output_lines < <(go list -f '{{.Dir}} - {{.TestGoFiles}} {{.XTestGoFiles}}' ./...)
```

With this bash 3.2 compatible version:
```bash
output_lines=()
while IFS= read -r line; do
    output_lines+=("$line")
done < <(go list -f '{{.Dir}} - {{.TestGoFiles}} {{.XTestGoFiles}}' ./...)
```

### Workaround for GNU Utilities

Install GNU versions via Homebrew:
brew install coreutils gnu-getopt

### Add to ~/.zshrc or ~/.bash_profile:
export PATH="/usr/local/opt/coreutils/libexec/gnubin:$PATH"
export PATH="/usr/local/opt/gnu-getopt/bin:$PATH"

### Testing Help Needed

I don't have access to macOS to test these changes. Could someone please:

1. Test if the modified check_pkg_test.sh works with the change above
2. Verify if the GNU utilities installation resolves issues with other scripts
3. Try running make and make run-backend after installing dependencies (the gnu utility, docker etc.)
4. Report any other script failures and their error messages

Once confirmed working, we should create a PR with:
- The script compatibility fix
- Updates to the main README

Any macOS developers willing to help test? 🙏

issueDTO.title: [Android] Svg swallowing touch events
issueDTO.description:
# Bug

When svg view is placed over other elements, touch events on it behave differently for ios and android. On ios it goes through to the underlying element, which is very useful. On android it doesn't, the touch event ends up in the svg, even though no shape inside it was touched.

It seems like a minor issue but for my use case it is actually absolutely critical.

## Environment info

<!--
  Run `react-native info` in your terminal and copy the results here. Also, include the *precise* version number of this library that you are using in the project
-->

React native info output:

```bash
  React Native Environment Info:
    System:
      OS: macOS 10.14.4
      CPU: (4) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-8210Y CPU @ 1.60GHz
      Memory: 27.04 MB / 8.00 GB
      Shell: 3.2.57 - /bin/bash
    Binaries:
      Node: 12.2.0 - /usr/local/bin/node
      Yarn: 1.16.0 - /usr/local/bin/yarn
      npm: 6.9.0 - /usr/local/bin/npm

issueDTO.title: Improve our test coverage
issueDTO.description:
### Feature description

Many of our existing algorithm files have little to no unit testing. This is problematic because this can easily let bugs slip through. We want some assurance that the code we currently have is correct and functional. We welcome all contributors to open PRs to help us add tests to our codebase.

### How to find low-coverage files

Go to the Actions tab in this repository and find the most recent **build** workflow run. Open the logs under "Run Tests" and scroll down until you find the section on code coverage:
```
---------- coverage: platform linux, python 3.12.0-final-0 -----------
Name                                                                          Stmts   Miss  Cover   Missing
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
quantum/q_fourier_transform.py                                                   30     30     0%   14-93
scripts/validate_solutions.py                                                    54     54     0%   2-94
strings/min_cost_string_conversion.py                                            78     75     4%   20-57, 61-75, 79-129
...
```
The "Cover" column tells you what percentage of the lines in that file are covered by tests. We want to increase this percentage for existing files. Find a file with low coverage percentage that you wish to write tests for, add doctests for each function, and open a PR with your changes. You do not need to have a perfect coverage percentage, but all functions should have doctests.

Some files will naturally be hard to write tests for. For example, the file may be poorly written because they lack any functions. Other files might be how-tos, meaning they simply demonstrate how to use an existing library's functions rather than implementing the algorithm themselves. Ignore these kinds of files, as they will need to be rewritten eventually. Furthermore, ignore files in the `web_programming` and `project_euler` directories. Web programming files are inherently hard to test and Project Euler files have their own validation workflow, so don't worry about their test coverage.

_**When you open your PR, put "Contributes to #9943" in the PR description.**_ Do not use the word "fixes", "resolves", or "closes". This issue is an ongoing one, and your PR will not single-handedly resolve this issue.

### How to add doctests

A doctest is a unit test that is contained within the documentation comment (docstring) for a function. Here is an example of what doctests look like within a docstring:
```py
def add(a: int, b: int) -> int:
    """
    Adds two non-negative numbers.
    >>> add(1, 1)
    2
    >>> add(2, 5)
    7
    >>> add(1, 0)
    1
    >>> add(-1, -1)
    Traceback (most recent last):
    ...
    ValueError: Numbers must be non-negative
    """
```
For every function in the file you choose, you should write doctests like the ones shown above in its docstring. If a function doesn't have a docstring, add one. Your doctests should be comprehensive but not excessive: you should write just enough tests to cover all basic cases as well as all edge cases (e.g., negative numbers, empty lists, etc).

Do not simply run a function on some example inputs and put its output as the expected output for a doctest. This assumes that the function is implemented correctly when it might not be. Verify independently that your doctests and their expected outputs are correct. **Your PR will not be merged if it has failing tests.** If you happen to discover a bug while writing doctests, please fix it.

_**Please read our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/TheAlgorithms/Python/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) before you contribute.**_

> How is the percentage determined? The tests I added only bumped the coverage by 1%

@RaymondDashWu The coverage percentage is calculated from the total number of lines covered by tests across _all_ files in the repo. As of writing, the latest builds show the following:
```
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
TOTAL                                                                         31846   9986    69%
```
There are 9986 lines of code in total _not_ covered by tests compared to 31846 lines of code in total, which is how the 69% comes about. The tests that you added only improved the coverage for _one_ file out of the hundreds of files that we have, and that's why it barely changed the percentage at all.

This is why I said in my previous comment that this is an _ongoing_ issue. No single PR will improve our coverage enough to "fix" this issue.

issueDTO.title: cdk init app: space causes failure
issueDTO.description:
### What is the problem?

When running the `cdk init app --language csharp` command from a directory that has a space in its path, I get the following error:

`~\Documents\My Projects\CdkTesting> cdk init app --language csharp`

```
Applying project template app for csharp
Unrecognized command or argument 'Projects\CdkTesting\src\CdkTesting.sln'
Description:
  Add one or more projects to a solution file.

Usage:
  dotnet [options] sln <SLN_FILE> add [<PROJECT_PATH>...]

Arguments:
  <SLN_FILE>      The solution file to operate on. If not specified, the command will search the current directory for
                  one. [default: C:\Users\Scott\Documents\My Projects\CdkTesting\]
  <PROJECT_PATH>  The paths to the projects to add to the solution.

Options:
  --in-root                                Place project in root of the solution, rather than creating a solution
                                           folder.
  -s, --solution-folder <solution-folder>  The destination solution folder path to add the projects to.
  -?, -h, --help                           Show command line help.

Could not add project CdkTesting.csproj to solution CdkTesting.sln. Error code: 1
```

### Reproduction Steps

Run 'cdk init app --language csharp' from a directory with a space in the path

### What did you expect to happen?

A project to be created

### What actually happened?

Loud noises and explosions

### CDK CLI Version

2.10.0 (build e5b301f)

### Framework Version

_No response_

### Node.js Version

v12.22.7

### OS

Windows

### Language

.NET

### Language Version

C#

### Other information

Moving to a directory without a space in the path solved the issue.
comments:
Hello @ryparker @rix0rrr , I have a question about this PR.
In this specific scenario, the source directory needs to have a space in the name. Shall I create one more integration test for this or a unit test with child_process.spawn function stubbed?
Thank you @bhargav50  for getting a fix created. I have also ran into this and just removed the spaces from my explorer as a quick fix for the time being.

issueDTO.title: ENH Add `pos_label` parameter to `TargetEncoder`
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the workflow you want to enable

Add a `pos_label` parameter to `TargetEncoder` to enable the user to specify which label should be the positive class when the target is binary.

### Describe your proposed solution

Add a `pos_label` parameter that is passed to the `LabelBinarizer` `pos_label` parameter.

### Describe alternatives you've considered, if relevant

_No response_

### Additional context

Ref: https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/pull/26674#discussion_r1317446826

cc @ogrisel
comments:
Indeed, it makes sense. I am also thinking that the current validation of `LabelBinarizer` is not support UX friendly since it accepts only `Integral` values. I assume that we should be able to pass any type of classes.

Then we could use the `_check_pos_label_consistency` and improve it as well by passing `classes` if already computed (to avoid calling `np.unique`) and also add an extra check that `pos_label` is in `classes`.
/take

Hi @ivantishchenko, just checking in to see if you're still working on this issue. If not, I'd be happy to take it over or collaborate if you're open to it. Let me know what works best — totally understand if you're busy or it's still in progress!

Thanks!

@tvp590 I'm currently very busy with my main project and won't be able to finish the code for this issue in the near term.

Please feel free to take over. I'd be happy to review your code and help where I can.

issueDTO.title: storage_service/get_natural_endpoints has no way to pass a key containing a colon character
issueDTO.description:
As noted by @KrzaQ:
> How do I use nodetool getendpoints with compound keys? The internet advice seems to be pass the key separated by colon (e.g. nodetool getendpoints mykeyspace superheroes "peter:parker" ), but what do I do if the key itself contains colons?
In my case - audit.audit_log, one of the columns is of type timestamp, so a value could be 2023-12-31 00:00:00.000000+0000 .
I tried following the java code for the tool, but no luck yet.

To enable support at the jmx/nodetool level (or scylla-nodetool), the scylla api needs to support a way to pass key values containing `:`, otherwise they are recognized as composite keys, with the column as key delimiter.

Since the key is passed over an http-based interface I suggest to allow encoding `:` characters using the standard http encoding as `%3A` substrings (`seastar::http::internal::url_decode` can be used to decode such strings).
comments: Although it isn't specified in the RFC (https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986#section-3.4) many libraries allow passing the same query parameter multiple times, e.g. `somequery?key=3&key=4`. If Seastar doesn't mess this up (e.g., by using a map instead of a list), this can be a way to specify two key components without needing to invent yet another serialization format.

According to https://support.datastax.com/s/article/HOW-TO-Specify-composite-partition-keys-for-SSTable-utilities, the colon is expected to work - although this isn't officially specified in the nodetool getendpoints documentation so I'm note sure we should follow this bad advice:

The reason why this is a bad syntax is that it makes keys like "a:b" ambiguous - is it one component with the ":" character, or two components? It's not an issue of implementation, it's a bug in nodetool syntax that makes this case ambiguous and nodetool has no idea what the user intended.

> Since the key is passed over an http-based interface I suggest to allow encoding `:` characters using the standard http encoding as `%3A` substrings (`seastar::http::internal::url_decode` can be used to decode such strings).

I'm not sure if that was your intention, but such encoding (which obviously has to happen when building the REST API URL), will not help to differentiate whether "a:b" is two components or one with a colon. Also, if the nodetool API is already ambgious (what does the "a:b" the user passed mean?) there is no way that additional encoding can fix it.

If you change anything in this area, please don't forget to add tests.

From the api standpoint what I had in mind is to pass `key=a%3Ab` if the non-composite key (or one of its components) contains `:`.
The user can pass that to nodetool as well.

That said, allowing passing multiple components as request parameters is possible too, though with the current interface it is not intuitive to assume that the multiple key parameters indicate multiple components of a composite key rather than multiple keys, if the API supported returning the natural endpoints for multiple keys.

Note that `%3A` is supported for `keyspace:table` "tuples" when passed as a single parameter or as a comma-separated list of `keyspace:table`, to support keyspace or table names containing `:`.

> From the api standpoint what I had in mind is to pass `key=a%3Ab` if the non-composite key (or one of its components) contains `:`. The user can pass that to nodetool as well.

`key=a%3Ab` is the url-encoded form of setting key to `a:b`. But now that Scylla receives it, how does it know if this was intended to be a string key `a:b` or two components?

Maybe you were thinking of encoding **twice**? If that's the case, the first layer of encoding doesn't need to be URL encoding. Just the outer layer of encoding must be.

Are you sure about what you said about `keyspace:table` allowing real ":"? Last time I checked, I found that at least in one context, you are only allowed to have colons in the table name, not keyspace name (e.g., in Alternator GSI), and what happens is simply that Scylla splits only on the first colon, so `xyz:abc:qwe` means that `xyz` is the keyspace, `abc:qwe` is the table. That's a different thing that what you are hoping to do here.
Can't we use key:"value:has:colons"?

> Can't we use key:"value:has:colons"?

Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed).
But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.

Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.

Like @nyh said, we still need to fix the nodetool layer to support composite keys containing `:`.
There, one could use string quoting or even hex encoding to represent binary key values.

> Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed). But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.

But it won't be "consistent" - you'll need to run the URL encoding **twice**, which is possible, but not something traditionally done in HTTP. So we gain nothing by making the "inner" encoding also another invocation of the URL encoding, it can be something else like quotes or backslashing colons or something. Whatever this inner encoding is, it will need to be documented.
 
> Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.

Yes, this is similar to what I suggested above, although theoretically you don't even need to change the existing option "key" if you just allow it to be given multiple times - unless giving a key multiple times has another meaning in the API (maybe an OR of several different keys)? @amnonh would know.

> > Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed). But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.
> 
> But it won't be "consistent" - you'll need to run the URL encoding **twice**, which is possible, but not something traditionally done in HTTP. So we gain nothing by making the "inner" encoding also another invocation of the URL encoding, it can be something else like quotes or backslashing colons or something. Whatever this inner encoding is, it will need to be documented.
> 
> > Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.
> 
> Yes, this is similar to what I suggested above, although theoretically you don't even need to change the existing option "key" if you just allow it to be given multiple times - unless giving a key multiple times has another meaning in the API (maybe an OR of several different keys)? @amnonh would know.

Currently, it's a singleton, see:
https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/blob/f4bd86384b6ffbcab9af876f83b288bf3e83eab3/api/api-doc/storage_service.json#L565-L568
And we also have this limitation: https://github.com/scylladb/seastar/issues/693

> And we also have this limitation:#693

Wrong link?
Sorry, it's a seastar issue, updated the commnet

Another user just encountered this bug, being unable to use "nodetool getendpoints" with a partition key value that contained the ":"  character. That user, like probably a majority of users, had a single-column (non-compound) partition key. 

We can easily create a fix  for such users: partition_key::from_nodetool_style_string() could check if the schema has a single partition-key component, and if so, avoid the "split on :" logic entirely.

This fix will **not** help in the more general case of compound partition keys (for which an API change is required, as described above), but it would have helped this user, and all other users who have non-compound partition keys.

@amnonh suggested an API improvement for the general case (of compound partition keys, that do need a separator character): 
```
It's also possible to allow the user to override the delimiter (like we do in sed) for this cases
```
Adding this feature to the REST API will be easy, but adding it to nodetool will require a new option.
If my idea above for single-component partition key not splitting at all is _also_ implemented, many users including the ones that noticed this problem will not actually need to use this option.

@bhalevy I've created https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/pull/24720 based on @nyh idea.
I'm not sure it's the right approach, but you can take it from here

> [@bhalevy](https://github.com/bhalevy) I've created [#24720](https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/pull/24720) based on [@nyh](https://github.com/nyh) idea. I'm not sure it's the right approach, but you can take it from here

It's a good start and as @nyh said in https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/issues/16596#issuecomment-2961866634, it doesn't solve all cases, but the common case of a simple, single column partition key.

> [@paszkow](https://github.com/paszkow), [@tarasveretilnyk](https://github.com/tarasveretilnyk) that could be another good issue for ramping up
> 
> Can you please take [a8eaf02](https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/commit/a8eaf0253c7d7456e645bcc656270b59e9cc4230) forward, and add a unit test for it as well?

Regarding "unit" (not really) tests, I think there can/should be two levels of them:

1.  Test in test/rest_api that checks the REST API request in two cases: single-partition-key-column-and-colon-in-the-key and two-partition-key-column-and-colon-used-as-separator. Perhaps we already have a test for the latter case?
2. Test in dtest or test/nodetool (I'm not up to date on what's right) that checks the nodetool command, not rest api. What we change in the REST API **should** translate also to the nodetool command but it's not obvious that it does and should be tested. Some ideas raised in this issue required even more explicit changes to nodetool that would need to be tested.

Please also see my recommendation in https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/pull/24720 to improve the commit message to say exactly what we're fixing and what we aren't, and also consider which documentation we need to update to explain the situation with the colon.

> 
> [@denesb](https://github.com/denesb) should review
We should fix for non-singular keys too, otherwise we are just kicking the can down the road.

> We should fix for non-singular keys too, otherwise we are just kicking the can down the road.

It's unlikely we can fully resolve this for non-singular (composite) keys, especially when text columns are involved. Regardless of the delimiter used, there's always a risk of collision - either with actual characters in the key or encoded sequences such as `%3A`.

As for the alternative of specifying the ckey option multiple times (e.g., --ckey="part1" --ckey="part2"), that approach is also problematic. While nodetool might be able to parse such input reliably, we still need to pass it to our API. This would require merging the parts into a single string, which again reintroduces the possibility of ambiguous delimiters or collisions.

issueDTO.title: Centralise GH Action Secrets for Terraform Module Repos
issueDTO.description:
### User Story

As a Modernisation Platform Engineer,
I want to update the workflows in the MP terraform module repos to use the new centralised secrets management GitHub Action,
So that secrets are managed securely and consistently across all MP-managed repositories.

### Value / Purpose

- Align the MP terraform module workflows with the updated secrets management approach already implemented across other MP repositories.
- Reduce security risk and operational complexity by eliminating reliance on GitHub secrets (where applicable).
- Ensure consistency, maintainability, and compliance in how secrets are handled in CI/CD pipelines.


### Context / Background

This is a continuation of https://github.com/ministryofjustice/modernisation-platform/issues/10126 and https://github.com/ministryofjustice/modernisation-platform/issues/9024 where we have done this for the workflows in the `modernisation-platform` and `modernisation-platform-environments` repositories.

The module repos all use the testing-ci secrets for authenticating with the testing-test account for running terratest. These credentials can now be retrieved using the central github [action](https://github.com/ministryofjustice/modernisation-platform-github-actions/blob/main/.github/workflows/aws-secrets-management.yml)

### Useful Contacts

_No response_

### Additional Information

_No response_

### Definition of Done

- [ ] Update workflows
- [ ] Test
- [ ] Remove GH secrets

issueDTO.description:
### What should we do?

Rename Zeebe Cluster to Orchestration Cluster in Deployment Modal at least vor version 8.8+

### Why should we do it?

With our streamlined architecture we talk about Orchestration Cluster instead of a Zeebe cluster.
This should be aligned in Desktop Modeler deployment modal

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7b37735a-e2b0-482e-8139-ddbc8f324aa0)
comments: Probably worth to simply rename it consistently, across all Camunda 8 versions.
Do we want to change all occurrences of Zeebe? I noticed another error `Unsupported Zeebe version`, Would `Unsupported Engine version` be better?

> Do we want to change all occurrences of Zeebe? I noticed another error Unsupported Zeebe version, Would Unsupported Engine version be better?

We want to rename to orchestration cluster:

```
Unsupported Zeebe version -> Unsupported orchestration cluster version
```

This should also be reflected across [the documentation](https://docs.camunda.io/docs/next/components/modeler/desktop-modeler/), but we have to ensure to not break existing links used from within the modeler UI, i.e. [this](https://docs.camunda.io/docs/next/components/modeler/desktop-modeler/troubleshooting/#i-cannot-connect-to-zeebe); if we break, then we have to redirect old ones.

issueDTO.title: [RFC]: Unit test coverage improvement
issueDTO.description:
### Motivation

This issue attempt to reduce the gap of unit tests to cover the code. There is a brief architecture of ut in `tests/ut/` already. We need to add more to cover all the code in vllm-ascend, and there are several principles to follow:

1. The overall file tree should be consistent with `vllm_ascend`
2. The file name should be the original file name with a prefix `test_`
3. Use `unittest` framework, make good use of mock
4. The UTs are all running on cpu node, mock the function related to device to host

Please refer to the official doc on [contributing](https://vllm-ascend.readthedocs.io/en/latest/developer_guide/contribution/index.html) and [testing](https://vllm-ascend.readthedocs.io/en/latest/developer_guide/contribution/testing.html) to develop, thanks!

issueDTO.title: Expose memory consumed by query execution on top queries page.
issueDTO.description:
Currently, [vmui](https://play.victoriametrics.com/select/0/vmui/?#/top-queries?topN=30&maxLifetime=30m) displays query duration, interval, and count. However, in some cases, this information alone isn't sufficient to identify heavy queries. It would be beneficial to also display the estimated memory usage per query (`memory_estimated_bytes` field).

For example, the queries `sum(a) + sum(b)` and `sum(a + b)` operate on the same number of samples but consume vastly different amounts of memory—the first is lightweight, while the second is significantly heavier.

By showing memory usage in the UI, such differences would be immediately visible, making it easier to detect and troubleshoot inefficient queries.

While we are on it, can we expose at this plage samples processed by query too ?

repository.description: VictoriaMetrics: fast, cost-effective monitoring solution and time series database
repository.name: VictoriaMetrics

summary.validationOrRequirement: memory_estimated_bytes field
