issueDTO.title: <shift>-<enter> should do an enter but keep user control
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Sometimes I want to tell gemini cli: 
"""
Look at this output, this is clearly wrong:

  - gic_migration_2024_06_25: ✅ Assertion passed: Command succeeded.
  - sakura_repo_exists: ✅ Path exists: /Users/ricc/git/sakura
"""

Where the first part (lines 1/2) im typing and the second part (3/4) is the output of some commands i cut pasted.

However, as soon as I press the first eNTER i lose control and gemini cli gets it. We need to have some mechanism to introduce an <ENTER> without ceding focus to the LLM and still be in tyiuping mode.

I suppose SHIFT ENTER is the most natural, but happy to consider others too (or maybe one exists and Im not aware of it)
comments:
I'd support this, and it would be a good first issue for someone interested in contributing.

If no one takes it though then I will.

Heads up, we do support shift-enter on mac if you follow the same steps that Claude asks you to follow to configure your terminal to support it. https://b.corp.google.com/issues/424007249 has more details.
Related: #1699
,take

Just to add, I personally use the Warp Terminal on Mac. By default, Warp allows you to add a new-line using either of the following:

* ⇧ + ↵ Enter
* ⌥ + ↵ Enter

But once you are running Gemini, it doesn't work with either approach.
Thamks for the info on warp. We would really appreciate a pull request to make both of them work  when Gemini Cli is running in warp.

hey @maisyk as per my knowledge warp isnt a terminal on its own, it uses a custom Rust-based UI framework and handles input at the application layer, not via the OS TTY driver

Warp collects keystrokes in its own internal editor, only sending the buffer to the shell on Enter or whatever you configure

so when we use gemini on warp, it is no different than using a gemini on a normal terminal, i hope this helps us understand this issue better

hey @jacob314 i have been trying to create pull requests, but i have been getting this cla error, i tried going through the the entire process mentioned in the initial readme file. i mightve made some error surely but im not able to fix it or anything i dont even know what really is happening
Can you show a screenshot or paste of the error you get?
@ShubhamSachdeva311205 happy to help but like @palladius I can't see the screenshot showing the error you are getting.
@jacob314 @palladius

Looks like one of your commits has your correct email and one has the wrong e-mail. Easiest way to fix this is to use git rebase -i to squash down to 1 commit and then force an upload again. You may want to track down which of your tools was using the wrong email... or no e-mail hence the macbook.local thing.

This needs to be in the docs (new `/help` has keyboard shortcuts in the end) for new line or line break. Leaving a comment here for anyone looking to create a new line:

1. `\ + Enter`
2. `Option + Enter` (only Mac OS)
3. `Ctrl + J`

Upgraded to a new version of gemini-cli and shift+enter stopped working (going to next line)
That still works in claude code though (I'm working out of Windsurf editor atm)
hey @leonk-sportsbet wdym "stopped working" was it working on the older versions ?

repository.description: An open-source AI agent that brings the power of Gemini directly into your terminal.
repository.name: gemini-cli

summary.main: Implement Shift+Enter to introduce an Enter key without losing control and still being in typing mode on the default macOS Terminal.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires a solution to make Shift+Enter work as expected on the default macOS Terminal, possibly by using a different key combination or mechanism.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author attempted a code-only fix by teaching the application to listen for a different key combination, Shift+Down, which often sends a unique sequence on other terminals. However, this proof-of-concept did not work due to the terminal stripping the Shift modifier information from both the Enter key and the arrow keys.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about the default macOS Terminal not supporting Shift+Enter to introduce an Enter key without losing control and still being in typing mode. The investigation found that Shift+Enter sends the same sequence as a regular Enter press, making it indistinguishable. The team is looking for a solution to make Shift+Enter work as expected.

issueDTO.title: `api-configuration` module name should be adapted
issueDTO.description:
# Feature Request

Currently the `api-configuration` module, that is meant to configure the `identity` api context it is named (and published) `api-configuration`, but it should be renamed to `identity-api-configuration` to keep consistency with other `api-configuration` modules (as `management`, `control` and so on)

## Which Areas Would Be Affected?

_e.g., DPF, CI, build, transfer, etc._

## Why Is the Feature Desired?

_Are there any requirements?_

## Solution Proposal

_If possible, provide a (brief!) solution proposal._

issueDTO.title: Make `start-canton.sh` and `start-frontends.sh` robust to `tmux` having been launched elsewhere
issueDTO.description:
[ This issue was auto-migrated from DA's internal repo (DACH-NY/canton-network-node#19801). Original author: @martinflorian-da ]

## What is this about?

Context: https://github.com/DACH-NY/canton-network-node/pull/19787#discussion_r2125941247

If you start tmux in nix environment 1, and then run `start-x.sh` in nix environment 2, then it will use the binaries from environment 1 which is very confusing.

Ideas for fixing:

- do a `which command` and execute the result in the tmux instead of just `command`
- do a `nix develop path:nix` in every new tmux pane, like what was done in `start-frontends.sh` prior to it being removed in https://github.com/DACH-NY/canton-network-node/pull/19787 ; note that on the nix upgrade attempt there this made things slower to the point of actually failing to start on CI

## How important is this and why?

@moritzkiefer-da is unhappy without this and to be fair it seems easy to fix, while the issue seems like it can easily lead to difficult debugging sessions
comments:
I could not reproduce the issue described here. What exactly is meant by "nix enviroment 1"? is it not the direnv auto-created env?

For testing I created this dummy script in the shell.nix to replace `canton`

```
  dummyCanton = pkgs.writeShellScriptBin "canton" ''
    echo "DEBUG: DUMMY canton executed"
  '';
```
```
divam@divam-ubuntu-cinnamon:~/repos/daml/work/splice1$ canton
DEBUG: DUMMY canton executed
```


And I created a tmux session from this dir which contains the correct `canton`

```
divam@divam-ubuntu-cinnamon:~/repos/daml/splice$ canton --version
Canton: 3.3.0-SNAPSHOT
Daml Libraries: 3.3.0-snapshot.20250624.13835.0.v78d74d4a
Stable Canton protocol versions: List(33)
Preview Canton protocol versions: List()
```

After this I did the `start-canton.sh` from `splice1` dir

```
divam@divam-ubuntu-cinnamon:~/repos/daml/work/splice1$ ./start-canton.sh -p local
Creating local Postgres instance
initdb: warning: enabling "trust" authentication for local connec
```

Inside the new tmux session created by this script I do see the dummy canton being executed.

```
divam@divam-ubuntu-cinnamon:~/repos/daml/work/splice1$ EXTRA_CLASSPATH=/nix/store/8mbn324qx6d8jk5jbks5w3w1bakhmii0-cometbft-driver/driver.jar      COMETBFT_DOCKER_IP=      CANTON_TOKEN_FILENAME=canton-simtime.tokens CANTON_PARTICIPANTS_FILENAME=canton-simtime.participants JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS="-Xms6g -Xmx8g -Dlogback.configurationFile=./scripts/canton-logback.xml" canton       -c ./apps/app/src/test/resources/simple-topology-canton-simtime.conf        --log-level-canton=DEBUG       --log-encoder json       --log-file-name log/canton-simtime.clog       --bootstrap bootstrap-canton.sc       2>&1 | tee -a log/canton-simtime.out
DEBUG: DUMMY canton executed
```

repository.description: Reference applications for funding, operating, and incentivizing the use of a decentralized, public Canton synchronizer. Includes the Amulet reference application for creating native payment utilities for Canton synchronizers and Daml applications.
repository.name: splice

summary.main: Make `start-canton.sh` and `start-frontends.sh` robust to `tmux` having been launched elsewhere
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue is important because @moritzkiefer-da is unhappy without this and it can easily lead to difficult debugging sessions.
summary.attemptedFixes: Ideas for fixing include doing a `which command` and executing the result in the tmux instead of just `command`, and doing a `nix develop path:nix` in every new tmux pane.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about making `start-canton.sh` and `start-frontends.sh` robust to `tmux` having been launched elsewhere. The main goal is to avoid using binaries from the wrong environment. Ideas for fixing include doing a `which command` and executing the result in the tmux instead of just `command`, and doing a `nix develop path:nix` in every new tmux pane.

issueDTO.title: Performance: pages under Personalization don't update Header
issueDTO.description:
The four pages under Personalization (Background, Accent color, Mouse pointers, Theme) don't update the NavigationView Header.

Reproduce:

- select Personalization
- open one of these pages (Header is "Personalization")
- go to another page (e.g. Settings)
- use "Back" button (on keyboard or mouse) to navigate back
- Header stays the same as for previous page
comments:
I understand the cause. When you go to settings page and then back to one of these, the header stays with "Settings", so that is surely not right.
Let's add a header text where we can. Should be super easy.

repository.description: Automatically switches between the dark and light theme of Windows 10 and Windows 11
repository.name: Windows-Auto-Night-Mode

summary.main: The pages under Personalization don't update the Header when navigating back.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The four pages under Personalization (Background, Accent color, Mouse pointers, Theme) don't update the NavigationView Header.
summary.attemptedFixes: Adding subtree can solve this problem, but we have rejected this plan before. We can change it anywhere by adding a public Header attribute for NavigationService.
summary.otherNotes: From our design point of view, this is actually not a bug, because the Header of NavigationView depends on the NavigationViewItem selected. However, for these four pages, this happens because they have no Item set.

issueDTO.title: Smoothen opacity on iOS Touchable
issueDTO.description:
The `TouchableOpacity` for iOS can be smoothen with the following prop `activeOpacity={0.8}`:

https://github.com/ikuseiGmbH/smart-village-app-app/blob/8f00c148db1ceef86b278975db472e986611321e/src/components/Touchable.js#L5

We already used this in https://github.com/ikuseiGmbH/smart-village-app-app/pull/62/files#diff-c419682ce198e95c29ad105c84adf7dbR24. This makes the element, which is touched, less transparent and smoothens the effect.

Maybe this can also be used for our `Button`?
comments: Maybe https://reactnavigation.org/docs/elements#platformpressable can be used

We use the `TouchableOpacity` component in many places in the app, but we use `activeOpacity={0.8}` in only 2 places (`ChipFilter`, `ImagesCarouselItem`). Do we want to make this update for the start, pause button in `ImagesCarousel`? We can add the `activeOpacity` prop instead of changing the whole component.
Why are you suggesting the change only for the `ImagesCarousel`?

> Why are you suggesting the change only for the `ImagesCarousel`?

Because the code blog in the description was targeting `ImagesCarousel`.

But now I see that you targeted `ImagesCarousel` because here we have a `TouchableOpacity` with `activeOpacity` prop. Actually, we are expecting a more in-depth change, right? For example, this could be added to the `TouchableOpacity` that we use in the `Touchable` component, and it could also be added to the `TouchableOpacity` components that we use in other parts of the code.

repository.description: An open source React Native app for smart villages merging regional offers and services in one place - in your pocket.
repository.name: smart-village-app-app

summary.validationOrRequirement: We use the `TouchableOpacity` component in many places in the app, but we use `activeOpacity={0.8}` in only 2 places (`ChipFilter`, `ImagesCarouselItem`). Do we want to make this update for the start, pause button in `ImagesCarousel`?
summary.attemptedFixes: Maybe https://reactnavigation.org/docs/elements#platformpressable can be used
summary.otherNotes: The `TouchableOpacity` for iOS can be smoothen with the following prop `activeOpacity={0.8}`. This makes the element, which is touched, less transparent and smoothens the effect. Maybe this can also be used for our `Button?`.

issueDTO.title: AIP-82: Add common messaging system providers
issueDTO.description:
### Body

related:  #49938

## Why

Several users have pointed out that the Event-Driven Scheduling feature introduced in Airflow 3 currently supports only Amazon SQS.

So I add Kafka common message queue provider in #49938, but there are still quite a few common providers that should be useful for airflow users to implement Event-Driven workflows.

## What

Here are some common messaging systems:

- [ ] Amazon Kinesis
- [ ] Amazon MSK
- [x] Amazon SQS
- [x] Apache Kafka
- [ ] Azure Message Bus
- [ ] Google PubSub
- [ ] Redis


reference for implementation: https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/49938/files

### Committer

- [x] I acknowledge that I am a maintainer/committer of the Apache Airflow project.
comments: Hi, may I try the pubsub one?
Hi, I would like to try the Redis one. Thanks!
hi, could I implement the "Azure Message Bus" one? thanks :)
Thanks all for making event-driven scheduling feature better!
Love it 👀
I's like to work on Amazon Kinesis, MSK

repository.name: airflow

summary.otherNotes: Several users have pointed out that the Event-Driven Scheduling feature introduced in Airflow 3 currently supports only Amazon SQS. reference for implementation: https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/49938/files

issueDTO.title: Add CLI flag to defer the autopilot loop
issueDTO.description:
### Description

The following scenario came to my mind:
I want to start `renterd` after a shutdown, but I want to change the config first (for instance, to reduce the number of contracts, or to choose other price limits).
However, as soon as `renterd` starts, the contract maintenance will jump in, and I will end up with the whole lot of contracts based on my old config, before I get a chance to change it.
Therefore, I think it would be nice to have a CLI flag that skips the first loop iteration.

### Version

_No response_

### What operating system are you running (e.g. Ubuntu 22.04, macOS, Windows 11)?

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_
comments: Don't you already have a bunch of contracts at that point? Since you had the autopilot running with your old config?

Not necessarily, they might have expired by then.
Although I admit, the scenario I described must be rather uncommon.
In that case I think we can add a flag that not just defers the loop but instead resets the autopilot on startup. Then the loop won't start until you have configured it again.

repository.description: A renter for Sia
repository.name: renterd

summary.main: Add CLI flag to defer or reset autopilot loop for configuration changes
summary.validationOrRequirement: None specified
summary.attemptedFixes: Reset the autopilot on startup instead of just deferring the loop

issueDTO.title: GitDagBundle: DAG processor fails to load versioned DAGs due to missing materialized folders
issueDTO.description:
### Apache Airflow Provider(s)

git

### Versions of Apache Airflow Providers

_No response_

### Apache Airflow version

3.0.2

### Operating System

Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS

### Deployment

Virtualenv installation

### Deployment details

_No response_

### What happened

When using GitDagBundle with `supports_versioning=True`, Airflow DAG Processor fails to execute DAG callbacks because it cannot find the materialized code under `versions/<commit_hash>/`.

Only the tracking_repo/ folder is updated with the latest version, but when a DAG-level callback (e.g. `on_success_callback`, `on_failure_callback`) is triggered, the callback request sent to the DAG Processor points to the versioned folder (e.g. `/dag-bundles/git_xxx/versions/<commit_hash>/dag.py`), which does not exist by default.

This leads to a failure in the DAG Processor when trying to load the DAG from the file. Specifically, inside `DagFileProcessor._execute_dag_callbacks`, the following code fails:
`dag = dagbag.dags[request.dag_id]  # returns empty
`

This happens because `dagbag.process_file()` cannot find the DAG file at the specified path (versions/<commit_hash>/...), and so the DAG is never loaded, and the callback is silently skipped.

### What you think should happen instead

The DAG Processor should also materialize the correct version of the DAG source code (i.e., clone the Git repository to the appropriate `versions/<commit_hash>` path) before attempting to load and execute DAG-level callbacks.



### How to reproduce

1. Use GitDagBundle with supports_versioning=True.
2. Define a DAG-level `on_failure_callback` or `on_success_callback`.
3. Deploy a new Git version and trigger a DAG run that invokes the callback.
4. The DAG tasks execute successfully.
5. But DAG callback fails because the path in the callback request is under versions/<commit_hash>/, which is not materialized
6. As a workaround, we patched GitDagBundle.refresh() to also clone the repo into the `versions/` directory.

### Anything else

In our environment, DAGs are triggered via Asset, but this should not affect the behavior.

### Are you willing to submit PR?

- [x] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
comments: Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template! If you are willing to raise PR to address this issue please do so, no need to wait for approval.

issueDTO.title: Let the user customize history search coloring
issueDTO.description:
### Discussed in https://github.com/marlonrichert/zsh-autocomplete/discussions/786
Originally posted by **norsemangrey** March 7, 2025 Anyone know if it is possible to to change the bg/fg colors of the history search? I'm trying to get it to look more like the completion predictor in PowerShell which I think looks nicer. Is it also possible to highlight all words/letters matching in the search? The fist matching word loses its highlight once starting on the next. zsh-autocomplete ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1c4e8fd1-9068-4593-8917-fa678eb44a1a) CompletionPredictor ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/39632c61-d807-4147-9e95-ba72eabb854d)
comments:
The history match coloring logic is somewhat complex:
https://github.com/marlonrichert/zsh-autocomplete/blob/1c2c985c8f2dbfc746aa5202736facc9e96438e0/Completions/_autocomplete__history_lines#L8-L38

So, letting the user fully customize is not really possible.

However, we could offer the user a `zstyle` that lets them replace the colors used (`=0`, `=2` and `=30;103` in the code).

issueDTO.title: Replace human-readable text with i18n keys
issueDTO.description:
For translation purposes, we need to replace all human-readable text in the UI components with `i18n(key)` calls. This will allow for easier localization in the future.

## Tasks
- [ ] Identify all human-readable text in files located under `./src/gui/src/UI`
- [ ] Replace each instance of human-readable text with `i18n(key)`
- [ ] Add corresponding translations for each key in `./src/gui/src/i18n/translations/en.js`

## Implementation Details
1. Go through each file in `./src/gui/src/UI`
2. For each human-readable string found:
   - Create a unique, descriptive key for the string
   - Replace the string with `i18n(key)`
   - Add the key-value pair to `./src/gui/src/i18n/translations/en.js`

## Example

Before:
```javascript
<button>Submit</button>
```

After:
```javascript
<button>{i18n('submit')}</button>
```
In `./src/gui/src/i18n/translations/en.js`:

```javascript
const en = {
    name: "English",
    english_name: "English",
    code: "en",
    dictionary: {
        // ... existing translations
        'submit_button_text': 'Submit',
        // ... existing translations
    }
}
```

## Additional Notes

- Ensure keys are descriptive and follow a consistent naming convention
- Be cautious with dynamic text or text that includes variables
- Consider context when creating keys to avoid potential conflicts

## Definition of Done

- All human-readable text in files under `./src/gui/src/UI` is replaced with `i18n(key)` calls.
- All new keys are added to `./src/gui/src/i18n/translations/en.js` with correct English translations.
- The application builds without errors and all UI elements display correctly.

issueDTO.title: Limit dag run history by number of runs
issueDTO.description:
Currently dagu limits history for dag run by number of days by defining configuration at global level via base.yaml or individual dag levels. This feature is very useful for cron jobs. For non cron jobs, it may never get used. For non cron jobs, the history of dag runs should be limited by the number of runs rather than number of days.

As suggested by @yottahmd, we can add something like this:
```yaml
historyRetention:
  runs: 3 # Limit by runs
  days: 5 # Limit by days
```
comments:
Thank you for submitting the issue. Here’s a proposed design with minimal changes:
```yaml
# keep the last 5 runs
historyRetentionRuns: 5

# keep for the last 5 days (already supported)
historyRetentionDays: 5
```
It should result in validation error when both specified.

To-Do:
- Implement `historyRetentionRuns` field and clean up logic
- Add unit tests
- Update documentation
- Update json schema
@yottahmd , I'm intereseted, can you kindly assign me this task

issueDTO.title: EBS CSI IRSA policy preventing creating tags on an EBS volume in case of using VAC
issueDTO.description:
## Description

Hi,

currently AWS EBS CSI IRSA policy prevents EBS CSI to edit tags if [VAC with tag specifications are applied](https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/aws-ebs-csi-driver/tree/master/examples/kubernetes/modify-volume#volume-modification-via-volumeattributesclass) to a pvc. This is the preventing policy:

```
  statement {
    actions = ["ec2:CreateTags"]

    resources = [
      "arn:${local.partition}:ec2:*:*:volume/*",
      "arn:${local.partition}:ec2:*:*:snapshot/*",
    ]

    condition {
      test     = "StringEquals"
      variable = "ec2:CreateAction"
      values = [
        "CreateVolume",
        "CreateSnapshot",
      ]
    }
  }
```

So the condition only permits creating tags on CreateAction while DeleteTags does not implement any condition.

If your request is for a new feature, please use the `Feature request` template.

- [X] ✋ I have searched the open/closed issues and my issue is not listed.

## Versions

- Module version [Required]:
5.54.0
- Terraform version:
1.11.4
- Provider version(s):
v5.83.0

## Reproduction Code [Required]

kubectl apply -f manifests/pod-with-volume.yaml
kubectl apply -f manifests/volumeattributesclass.yaml

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Create a VAC for which a tag is specified which will be created on the EBS volume
2. Set the volume attribute class on a PVC
3. EBS CSI volume fails with error:

`"Error from AWS API" err="api error UnauthorizedOperation: You are not authorized to perform this operation. User: ebs-csi-role is not authorized to perform: ec2:CreateTags on resource: <volume_arn> because no identity-based policy allows the ec2:CreateTags action.`

`failed to create tags" err="operation error EC2: CreateTags, https response error StatusCode: 403
`
## Expected behavior

When the condition:

```
    condition {
      test     = "StringEquals"
      variable = "ec2:CreateAction"
      values = [
        "CreateVolume",
        "CreateSnapshot",
      ]
    }
```

Is removed from the policy, EBS CSI controller is able to create a tag specified in VAC on an EBS volume.

## Actual behavior

EBS CSI fails to create tag due to AWS policy which permits creating tags only on a ec2:CreateAction
comments: and what is the recommended policy for using `VolumeAttributesClass`?

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open 30 days
with no activity. Remove stale label or comment or this issue will be closed in 10 days

Hi @bryantbiggs, I'm not sure what's the recommended policy, but it looks like [AWS-managed policy for EBS CSI driver](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/aws-managed-policy/latest/reference/AmazonEBSCSIDriverPolicy.html) still has the condition.
VACs are [supported in EKS since 1.31](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/containers/modify-amazon-ebs-volumes-on-kubernetes-with-volume-attributes-classes/) and modifying tags in existing volumes in EBS CSI driver using VACs is available and recommended since[ 1.33.0](https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/aws-ebs-csi-driver/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v1330).
What are the hard requirements to make an adjustment to the policy? I'm willing to make the adjustment if that helps moving this forward.
looks like we need to re-update our EBS CSI driver policy to match the current AWS policy - please feel free to open a PR

I'd like to take this issue and update the policy to match the current AWS-managed EBS CSI policy.  
Let me know if there's anything I should confirm before starting. Thanks!

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to allow EBS CSI controller to create a tag specified in VAC on an EBS volume by removing the condition from the policy.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The condition in the policy only permits creating tags on CreateAction, which is preventing EBS CSI from creating tags on an EBS volume.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author is willing to make the adjustment to the policy if that helps moving this forward.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is about EBS CSI IRSA policy preventing creating tags on an EBS volume in case of using VAC. The policy only permits creating tags on CreateAction while DeleteTags does not implement any condition. The issue is about removing the condition from the policy to allow EBS CSI controller to create a tag specified in VAC on an EBS volume.

issueDTO.title: [Template] Create a Design Critique template
issueDTO.description:
### Current Behavior
Currently for new users we do not have enough starter templates that they can use as introductory material.

### Desired Behavior
We want to create a Design Critique template to allow new users to understand how they can create a Design Critique diagram with Kanvas. So we'd want contributors to not just create a design template but also add tips or notes they think a new user would need if they are starting out with little to no context of the capabilities Kanvas offers.

### Implementation
Make sure you use [Kanvas](https://kanvas.new/extension/meshmap) to create this template and keep the template private.

- [ ] Provide a brief overview of what this template does and can help with, maybe highlight a usecase
- [ ] Add a template that can be directly copied and used instantaneously
- [ ] Add a step by step process to create this template
- [ ]  Once the design is completed, publish it and share the private link with our team, or tag us in the comment component to receive feedback.

### Acceptance Tests
- Template has been submitted for publishing to the catalog and accepted; is published and available in the Meshery Catalog.
- We are in need of well annotated and described templates like [this](https://playground.meshery.io/extension/meshmap?mode=design&design=ad9ec213-4e28-4cda-ba60-042b270ca0c3) one.
### Mockups
This [FigJam](https://www.figma.com/community/file/1085289819681923775) template can be used for recreating the Design Critique Template

### Perks
By contributing to this task, your efforts will have a lasting impact! Once published, your design will be cloned and used by countless users as a go-to starting point for creatingDesign Critique in Kanvas. You'll not only help newcomers understand the platform but also see your work adopted widely by the community. Plus, as a token of appreciation, you'll receive a special shoutout, recognising your valuable contribution. Your effort won’t go unnoticed—you're directly helping shape the experience for future users!

---
### Contributor [Guides](https://docs.meshery.io/project/contributing) and [Handbook](https://layer5.io/community/handbook)
- 🛠 [Meshery Build & Release Strategy](https://docs.meshery.io/project/contributing/build-and-release)
- 📚 [Instructions for contributing to documentation](https://github.com/meshery/meshery/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#documentation-contribution-flow)
   - Meshery documentation [site](https://docs.meshery.io/) and [source](https://github.com/meshery/meshery/tree/master/docs)
- 🎨 Wireframes and designs for Meshery UI in [Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/SMP3zxOjZztdOLtgN4dS2W/Meshery-UI)
- 🙋🏾🙋🏼 Questions: [Discussion Forum](http://discuss.meshery.io) and [Community Slack](https://slack.meshery.io)

issueDTO.title: Display language information to pois
issueDTO.description:
### Motivation
In our target group interviews, we (= target group team) got the input, that end users are insecure about going to pois, because they do not know if the language they know are spoken there. As which language is spoken is very different for every location, we want a text field, and hope the cms users will fill it with, e.g. "on thursday afternoon russian, on other days only german an englisch", or similar.


### Proposed Solution
<!-- A clear and concise description of the feature you would like to add, and how it solves the motivating problem. -->
Show the text that can be entered in the cms for every poi containing information about languages in web and native.

### Alternatives
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered, and why you're proposed solution is better. -->
We discussed if we just tell the cms users to add this information to the description field, but having this field is a constant reminder and as it is a important feature for the target group, we decided adding this field is the best way to go.

### User Story
<!-- A clear description of the User Stories that should be achieved by the new feature. The User Stories should follow this pattern:-->
As a app user I want know if at a poi my language is spoken so that I know if it is worth for me to go there.

### Additional Context
<!-- Add any other information or screenshots about the feature request here. -->
See: https://openproject.tuerantuer.org/projects/community-feedback/work_packages/3231/activity

### Design Requirements
<!-- If the customization includes input from our design team, the detailed requirements will be collected here. Note: These will exist mainly in German to simplify internal communication. -->
None.

blocked by https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/issues/2799
comments: Duplicated in https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-app/issues/2822 (might have additional information).

As discussed with @osmers in https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/issues/2799, the CMS team doesn't have this on their roadmap for the next three months but might implement the API endpoint returning an undefined soon-ish so that we can already work with that. The CMS can then implement the actual adding of languages later on; this would have the advantage of the municipalities being able to see their changes immediately in the app.

Design is ready and can be found [📌 here](https://www.figma.com/design/cA4F2MwHs2LNGviOWUjfE9/Integreat-Tickets-Frontend?node-id=4935-882&t=kGFrHSyaGLrKSPlZ-1). Let me know your thoughts @steffenkleinle @LeandraH
LGTM

issueDTO.title: Refactoring for Unit Test Access Controls
issueDTO.description:
Part of #12048

## Issue
After most of the Unit Test migration in #12048, there are a lot of inconsistencies in access control test methods. This is because we did not migrate the many convenient, abstracted, and commonly used access control test methods from `ui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java` to `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`.

After merging #13254, all of the access control test methods in `BaseActionTest.java` have been migrated. Hence, this issue aims to refactor the unit test access controls to use these convenient test methods.

## Progress
The progress for this refactoring can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IcB-viJMrIOknYoBYasBuRBK9qnwY0-doEK4_Eb24IA/edit?gid=0#gid=0). I (the author) will update it when completed PRs are merged proactively.

## Steps to Contribute

1. Choose test(s) to work on in the above Google Sheets link
2. Check that no on else have claimed the test cases to work on within the last 2 weeks, or that it has been completed by follow up PRs (but not updated in the sheets)
3. Comment on this issue to indicate that you'd like to contribute on the chosen test(s). Update your comment if you need more than 2 weeks so that other contributors don't overlap with your work.
4. Create a PR to refactor the unit test(s).
5. Submit the PR, with a link to this issue by starting the description with "Part of #13304"## Tips

- Understand the access control test methods in `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`, follow the refactoring in #13254
- Most of the access control testing logic in the migrated unit tests under `sqlui/webapi` follows the old unit tests under `ui/webapi`, so you may wish to reference the old unit test for help

issueDTO.title: Migrate remaining CLI input methods to use @clack/prompts for consistency
issueDTO.description:
# Migrate remaining CLI input methods to use @clack/prompts for consistency

## 🎯 Summary

Currently, the CLI uses a mix of input libraries (`inquirer`, Bun's global `prompt()`, and `@clack/prompts`). We should standardize on `@clack/prompts` for a consistent user experience and better styling across all CLI interactions.

## 📋 Current State

Most of the CLI already uses `@clack/prompts` properly, but there are **2 main files** still using other input methods:

### 1. `src/utils/plugin-creator.ts` - Using `inquirer` 📦

This file has multiple `inquirer.prompt()` calls that need to be migrated:

- **Plugin specification collection** (~line 172-290):
  - Plugin name input
  - Plugin description input  
  - Plugin features input
  - Component selection (checkbox)
  - Action names input
  - Provider names input
  - Evaluator names input
  - Service names input

### 2. `scripts/generate-unit-tests.ts` - Using global `prompt()` 🔧

- **Test generation confirmation** (~line 165):
  ```typescript
  const answer = prompt('Generate tests? (y/n): ');
  ```

## ✨ Benefits of Migration

1. **Consistent UX** - All CLI interactions will have the same look and feel
2. **Better styling** - Clack provides superior visual design and animations
3. **Better error handling** - Clack has built-in cancellation handling
4. **Reduced dependencies** - Can remove `inquirer` from package.json
5. **Type safety** - Better TypeScript integration

## 🔧 Implementation Examples

### For `plugin-creator.ts`:

**Before (inquirer):**
```typescript
const answers = await inquirer.prompt([
  {
    type: 'input',
    name: 'name',
    message: 'Plugin name (without "plugin-" prefix):',
    validate: (input: string) => input.length > 0 || 'Plugin name is required'
  }
]);
```

**After (clack):**
```typescript
const name = await clack.text({
  message: 'Plugin name (without "plugin-" prefix):',
  validate: (input) => input.length > 0 ? undefined : 'Plugin name is required'
});

if (clack.isCancel(name)) {
  clack.cancel('Operation cancelled.');
  process.exit(0);
}
```

### For `generate-unit-tests.ts`:

**Before:**
```typescript
const answer = prompt('Generate tests? (y/n): ');
```

**After:**
```typescript
const answer = await clack.confirm({
  message: 'Generate tests?',
  initialValue: true
});

if (clack.isCancel(answer)) {
  console.log('Cancelled.');
  return;
}
```

## ✅ Reference Files (Already Using Clack)

These files are already properly implemented and serve as good examples:
- `src/commands/create/actions/creators.ts`
- `src/commands/create/index.ts`
- `src/commands/env/actions/edit.ts`
- `src/commands/publish/utils/validation.ts`
- `src/utils/cli-prompts.ts`

## ✅ Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Replace all `inquirer.prompt()` calls in `plugin-creator.ts` with clack equivalents
- [ ] Replace global `prompt()` call in `generate-unit-tests.ts` with clack
- [ ] Remove `inquirer` dependency from `package.json` if no longer used elsewhere
- [ ] Ensure all prompts handle cancellation properly (ctrl+c)
- [ ] Test plugin creation flow works identically to current behavior
- [ ] Test unit test generation script works identically to current behavior
- [ ] Maintain existing validation logic and error messages
- [ ] Update any related TypeScript types if needed

## 🎯 Priority

**Medium** - This improves developer experience and code consistency but doesn't affect core functionality.

## 💡 Implementation Notes

- The `generate-unit-tests.ts` part would be a good **beginner-friendly** task
- The `plugin-creator.ts` part is more complex due to multiple sequential prompts
- Consider breaking this into two separate PRs if needed
- Make sure to test the checkbox selection for component types in plugin creation

---

**Note**: The majority of the CLI already uses clack properly - this is just cleaning up the last few stragglers to ensure complete consistency across the entire CLI experience.

issueDTO.title: answer node was not returned as expected.
issueDTO.description:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report (我已阅读并同意 [Language Policy](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/1542)).
- [x] [FOR CHINESE USERS] 请务必使用英文提交 Issue，否则会被关闭。谢谢！:)
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Dify version

1.5.0

### Cloud or Self Hosted

Self Hosted (Docker)

### Steps to reproduce

1. add a llm node and an answer node
2. add user content around the llm output
3. some tag not returned as expected.
4. it works fine in 1.4.3
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/31506500-868d-494c-8bb7-f31e9798cd10)

### ✔️ Expected Behavior

expected answer is ‘
开始
<tag>
llm output
</tag>
结束
’

### ❌ Actual Behavior

actual answer is ‘
开始
<tag></tag>
llm output
结束
’
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
This looks like a regression in how the answer node merges user content and LLM output in Dify 1.5.0. The core logic for assembling the answer changed in recent updates, specifically in the `_run` method of `answer_node.py`, which now processes and merges template/user text and LLM output differently. This likely causes the LLM output to appear outside your custom tags, leaving the tag empty instead of wrapping the LLM output as before [[source]](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/37e19de7ab3d8c1ffd8dfd8b789ff52b47f981cb/api/core/workflow/nodes/answer/answer_node.py).

There’s no documentation or open issue directly tracking this, but similar regressions have happened before when output formatting or merging logic was refactored. If you need a workaround, try adjusting your template or node configuration to see if you can force the LLM output inside the tag, or temporarily revert to 1.4.3 if that’s feasible for your deployment. If you’re using structured output, double-check your schema and model compatibility, as recent changes in structured output handling have also caused related issues for some users [[source]](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/20975).

If you need to track this for a future fix, keep an eye on changes to `answer_node.py` and related workflow node logic in upcoming releases.

[@dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot).
I have checked code in the _run method of answer_node.py. It seems that changed part only add a wrapper "ArrayFileSegment" of return files. I doubt if this will change the answer of my custom tag.

<!-- Answer -->
You're correct—adding the ArrayFileSegment wrapper only affects how file outputs are handled and does not impact string outputs or the formatting of your custom tags in the answer node. The regression with your custom tag is more likely due to changes in how the answer node parses and merges templates and variables. Specifically, the answer is now assembled by splitting your template into text and variable chunks, then merging them, which can cause issues if the chunk boundaries don't align with your tags (for example, if you have a template like `<tag>{{#llm#}}</tag>`) [[source]](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/37e19de7ab3d8c1ffd8dfd8b789ff52b47f981cb/api/core/workflow/nodes/answer/answer_stream_generate_router.py).

If your tags are ending up empty, it's likely because the variable replacement logic is splitting the template in a way that separates the tag from the variable. This is unrelated to ArrayFileSegment and is instead a subtle change in the template parsing or merging logic. You might be able to work around this by adjusting your template so that the variable is not directly inside the tag, or by experimenting with different placements of your tags and variables. If you need to dig deeper, reviewing the logic in AnswerStreamGeneratorRouter and the template parsers (PromptTemplateParser, VariableTemplateParser) will show exactly how the chunks are split and merged.

the code in AnswerStreamGeneratorRouter、PromptTemplateParser、VariableTemplateParser don't change between version 1.4.3 and 1.5.0. 
Additionally, i found that in debug panel. it shows the right answer.
[@dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot).
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dc1ddf3b-3ee1-49c3-91e5-6d8b32f3be1e)

<!-- Answer -->
The reason the debug panel shows the correct answer but the user-facing output does not is due to a change in the frontend markdown rendering logic in Dify 1.5.0. The frontend now uses a custom Rehype plugin that strips or alters any HTML tag that doesn't match the regex /^[a-z][a-z0-9]*$/i, converting it to plain text. This means custom tags (like `<tag>`) are no longer rendered as HTML elements, which is why your LLM output appears outside the tag or the tag appears empty in the UI, even though the backend (and debug panel) output is correct. This stricter sanitation was likely added for security reasons and is not documented as a breaking change, so it may not have been present or as strict in 1.4.3 [reference](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/37e19de7ab3d8c1ffd8dfd8b789ff52b47f981cb/web/app/components/base/markdown/index.tsx).

To work around this, you can use only standard HTML tags supported by the renderer, or adjust your template to avoid custom tags. If you need custom tag support, you would need to patch the frontend markdown renderer to relax or remove this restriction. Let me know if you want more details on how to do that.

summary.main: The answer node is not returning the expected output, specifically the LLM output is not being wrapped in the custom tags.

summary.attemptedFixes: Try adjusting your template or node configuration to see if you can force the LLM output inside the tag, or temporarily revert to 1.4.3 if that's feasible for your deployment. If you need to track this for a future fix, keep an eye on changes to `answer_node.py` and related workflow node logic in upcoming releases.
summary.otherNotes: Regression in how the answer node merges user content and LLM output in Dify 1.5.0. The core logic for assembling the answer changed in recent updates, specifically in the `_run` method of `answer_node.py`, which now processes and merges template/user text and LLM output differently. This likely causes the LLM output to appear outside your custom tags, leaving the tag empty instead of wrapping the LLM output as before.

issueDTO.title: [DAG] SDPatternMatch - m_Zero can't see through bitcasts
issueDTO.description:
X86 uses ISD::isBuildVectorAllZeros to peek through bitcasts to match zero vectors in a large number of combines.

Ideally we'd use SDPatternMatch to match these combines and use m_Zero() instead, but regrettably this fails to match the zero vectors through bitcasts,

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/84397c61f44e62231d1876a745a0c1f74ea8a5b8 shows an example of the regression

If we convert m_Zero() to something closer to m_AllOnes / AllOnes_match we might be able to make this work.
comments:
Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor has already been assigned to this issue. If you believe that no one is actually working on it despite an assignment, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. In the comments of this issue, request for it to be assigned to you, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.

@llvm/issue-subscribers-good-first-issue

Author: Simon Pilgrim (RKSimon)

<details>
X86 uses ISD::isBuildVectorAllZeros to peek through bitcasts to match zero vectors in a large number of combines.

Ideally we'd use SDPatternMatch to match these combines and use m_Zero() instead, but regrettably this fails to match the zero vectors through bitcasts,

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/84397c61f44e62231d1876a745a0c1f74ea8a5b8 shows an example of the regression

If we convert m_Zero() to something closer to m_AllOnes / AllOnes_match we might be able to make this work.
</details>
Hi, I'd like to work on this issue. Could the issue be assigned to me? Thanks!
Good luck! Please keep this ticket updated with your progress so nobody thinks it has been abandoned.
@average-avancha Any progress?

Hi @RKSimon, sorry for the delay but I managed to put together a fix that should allow m_Zero to peek through bitcasts. I'm still testing the solution locally but I think it should work.

Here's my fix on a fork of the repo: https://github.com/average-avancha/llvm-project/pull/1

I can move forward with an actual PR once I'm done locally testing.
I'd appreciate any feedback, thanks!
@average-avancha The patch looks like it's just for IR PatternMatch, have you made any progress on the DAG SDPatternMatch equivalent?
Not at the moment, seems like my effort was misguided. I'll work through the DAG SDPatternMatch section. Sorry about the confusion.
@average-avancha reverse-ping
@RKSimon if @average-avancha isn’t actively working on this, I’d like to claim this issue
ping @average-avancha

issueDTO.title: [azuremonitorreceiver] Collect metrics labels from Azure Resource tags
issueDTO.description:
### Component(s)

receiver/azuremonitor

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

For FinOps consideration, we need to count TS coming from each resources / subscriptions.


### Describe the solution you'd like

We have already a tag "service" on all our Azure resources. 

We need to map this "service" tag into "service" metrics labels so that we can then easily count TS for each service.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Tip

<sub>[React](https://github.blog/news-insights/product-news/add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) with 👍 to help prioritize this issue. Please use comments to provide useful context, avoiding `+1` or `me too`, to help us triage it. Learn more [here](https://opentelemetry.io/community/end-user/issue-participation/).</sub>
comments: /labels receiver/azuremonitor -needs-triage good-first-issue

Pinging code owners for receiver/azuremonitor: @nslaughter @celian-garcia @ishleenk17. See [Adding Labels via Comments](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#adding-labels-via-comments) if you do not have permissions to add labels yourself. For example, comment '/label priority:p2 -needs-triaged' to set the priority and remove the needs-triaged label.
/labels never-stale

Hi @celian-garcia Would it be okay if I take on this issue?
Also, I’d really appreciate it if you could provide a more detailed explanation of the problem and the expected solution?

😲 I feel bad. Checking the implementation to give you details, I actually found out that something was already existing but not documented. 

Following config
```yaml
append_tags_as_attributes: true
```
Is getting all the tags of the scraped resource and append them with label tags_{tag}={tag_value}

Despite this would work, I would like to have a bit more control. Some tags could have a uncontrolled cardinality. 

So what I propose would be to turn that field into a list (breaking change are okish since it's alpha)
Similar to what has been done there https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/blob/main/receiver/azuremonitorreceiver/README.md#filtering-metrics
```yaml
append_tags_as_attributes: [*] # takes every tag
append_tags_as_attributes: ["service", "something"] # takes only tags service and something
```
@Angith don't hesitate to tell me if you want more precisions.
Thanks @celian-garcia. Let me go through it and come back to you.
@celian-garcia can I work on this
Well @Angith said he would check so I believe it's fair to give him some days.
@celian-garcia I caught up with some other work. Currently, I am working on this issue. I will give you an update by the end of this week. 🙂

issueDTO.title: Some text on the p5.js Editor “About” page is not translated
issueDTO.description:
### p5.js version

2.0.1

### What is your operating system?

Windows

### Web browser and version

Chrome Version 136.0.7103.93

### Actual Behavior

When viewing the “About” page of the p5.js Editor in a non-English language (e.g., Spanish), some sections still display text in English. This includes the introductory paragraph and various descriptions under sections like “Get Involved” and “Resources,” which remain untranslated even though the rest of the UI is localized.

### Expected Behavior

All static text on the “About” page should be fully translated and displayed in the selected language, ensuring a consistent and complete user experience across all supported locales.

### Steps to reproduce

### Steps:
1. Open a sketch in the web editor.
2. Select the language other than english.
3. Go to Help section and click on About.

issueDTO.title: feat: Add `timeoutSec` at step level
issueDTO.description:
### What

Add `timeoutSec` at step level.

### Problem
DAG-level timeout applies to all steps equally. Different steps need different timeouts:
- API calls: seconds
- Data processing: hours
- Health checks: seconds

### Example
```yaml
steps:
  - name: health-check
    command: curl -f https://api.example.com
    timeoutSec: 5
    
  - name: process-data
    command: python heavy_job.py
    timeoutSec: 3600
```

### Current
- Timeout only in DAG struct

Hi @saishreyakumar, thank you very much for taking on this issue. Assigned to you. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask.

Hi @saishreyakumar, since you seem to be a bit busy at the moment, I’ll go ahead and unassign you for now. Feel free to reach out anytime if you find the time to work on this issue. Thanks again for your interest in contributing!

issueDTO.title: Add UI backdrop opacity control
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
F3D has a simple ImGui based UI which feature a backdrop for readability.
However this backdrop opacity is hardcode to 0.35, which may make the text unreadable depending on the background or HDRI.

F3D used to adapt text color automatically but this is not the case anymore as the backdrop makes the text readable at all time. But it would be nice to provide a way to control the opacity of the backdrop.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
 - Remove the non-functionnal "IsBackgroundDark" logic and associated tests
 - Add a libf3d option and CLI option `ui.backdrop.opacity`
 - Implement the logic to control the opacity in vtkF3DUIActor, vtkF3DImGUIActor and vtkF3DRenderer
 - Add testing and doc

Of course! Assigned.

issueDTO.title: Add support for block data from itemtype
issueDTO.description:
### Suggestion

Add itemtype support to `block data of %block%`

### Why?

Bukkit allows the creation of block data from a block or material, some people do not have a block reference.
And with skript not having a widely known system to get an itemtype from blockdata (`type of coak_ore[]`) I believe a better alternative is to simply allow itemtypes to be used within `block data of...` syntax.

### Other

_No response_

### Agreement

- [X] I have read the guidelines above and affirm I am following them with this suggestion.
comments: Seems like something I could do

@nylhus This has been on my todo list, but you can take it.

Essentially you would use the [BlockStateMeta ](https://jd.papermc.io/paper/1.20/org/bukkit/inventory/meta/BlockStateMeta.html) in Bukkit and apply it to an itemstack.
I have the exact syntax in Khoryl, and I was planning to add to Skript eventually. https://github.com/TheLimeGlass/Khoryl/blob/master/src/main/java/me/limeglass/khoryl/elements/item/EffApplyBlockStateItem.java

This allows for
```vb
set {_shield} to a shield
target block is a lime standing banner #can have banner patterns
apply the block state from the target block of player to {_shield}
set the offhand of the player to {_shield}
```

Do note that using itemtypes in the pattern does not work properly. I would recommend making it itemstack only!
ItemType's store their ItemMeta until applied to an ItemStack, and when we utilized this syntax, we found out that itemtypes did not save the block state for some reason.

For this reason, I made it an expression which acts just like ExprLore and applies it like an expression returning the ItemStack. (Changes not applied to the Khoryl remote repo yet)

Similarly to BlockStateMeta there is also BlockDataMeta which is essentially the exact same class just for BlockData.

I believe the BlockStateMeta is off topic for what I wanted this suggest to be. You're taking it as should we add it to `give player westward facing oak stairs` all I want here is `send blockdata of westward facing oak stairs`. The addition of that should be left to another issue or pr.

> I believe the BlockStateMeta is off topic for what I wanted this suggest to be. You're taking it as should we add it to `give player westward facing oak stairs` all I want here is `send blockdata of westward facing oak stairs`. The addition of that should be left to another issue or pr.

They're very close to being the same class and the implementation is the same, it's a developer note.

I don't see how it's the same class, you're modifying 1 class not multiple. It's just going to ExprBlockData and adding itemtype and it's usage. You're suggesting it being done directly to ItemType class from what I understand

> I don't see how it's the same class, you're modifying 1 class not multiple. It's just going to ExprBlockData and adding itemtype and it's usage. You're suggesting it being done directly to ItemType class from what I understand

No, I said it shouldn't be done with ItemType.

Alright, so now I'm even further confused what you're talking about after rereading it.

1. This suggest is to add `block data of %itemtype%` nothing about BlockStates 
2. if any form of change to item meta is to happen it's BlockDataMeta to support `westward facing oak stairs` to also fix issues like `give play oak wall sign` not giving an item, which I repeat is better for a whole other issue and pr.
3. Your idea is way off of what I want this issue to even do...and am very confused where you got it from this.

> Alright, so now I'm even further confused what you're talking about after rereading it.
> 
>     1. This suggest is to add `block data of %itemtype%` nothing about BlockStates
> 
>     2. if any form of change to item meta is to happen it's BlockDataMeta to support `westward facing oak stairs` to also fix issues like `give play oak wall sign` not giving an item, which I repeat is better for a whole other issue and pr.
> 
>     3. Your idea is way off of what I want this issue to even do...and am very confused where you got it from this.

BlockStateMeta and BlockDataMeta are very similar classes. I have an existing example using BlockStateMeta for banner data.

I get that this suggestion is BlockDataMeta, I'm helping aid an example of usage, you just swap BlockStateMeta for BlockDataMeta.

summary.main: Add support for block data from itemtype, specifically allowing itemtypes to be used within `block data of...` syntax.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires the ability to expose the `data` field in NewBlockValues and implement a method to get the block data from the itemtype.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author has an existing example using BlockStateMeta for banner data and is looking for assistance with implementing this feature. The author also mentions that they have the exact syntax in Khoryl, but it's not yet implemented in Skript.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about adding support for block data from itemtype, specifically allowing itemtypes to be used within `block data of...` syntax. The goal is to simplify the process of getting an itemtype from blockdata, similar to how Bukkit allows creation of block data from a block or material. The author has an existing example using BlockStateMeta for banner data and is looking for assistance with implementing this feature.

issueDTO.title: Add Issue and PR Templates
issueDTO.description: Create standard issue and pull request templates in `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/` and `.github/pull_request_template.md` for the repository.
comments:
I will start by researching best practices for GitHub issue and pull request templates to ensure they are clear, structured, and useful for contributors. Then, I’ll draft the following templates:

1. Issue Templates (in .github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/):
- bug_report.md – For reporting bugs with sections like "Steps to Reproduce" and "Expected Behavior."
- feature_request.md – For suggesting new features with sections like "Problem Description" and "Proposed Solution."
- documentation_improvement.md – For documentation-related updates.

2. Pull Request Template (.github/pull_request_template.md):
- Will include sections like "Description," "Related Issue," "Changes Made," and "Screenshots (if applicable)."

I’ll test the templates in a fork to ensure they render correctly before submitting a PR.
ETA: 2 days (including review and adjustments based on feedback).
Let me know if you'd like any modifications to this approach!
Amazing 🙏 looks great
Can i work on this?

issueDTO.title: [python-package] [R-package] every test catching an error should check for a specific error message
issueDTO.description:
## Description

Unit tests that assert that an error occurs should check that **a specific error** is raised.

Like this in Python:

https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_engine.py#L782-L783

And this in R:

https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/R-package/tests/testthat/test_basic.R#L209-L215

## Benefits of this work

* prevents tests from accidentally passing in the presence of an unrelated and unexpected error

## Acceptance criteria

* R: every use of `expect_error()` and `expect_warning()` in tests should pass argument `regexp` to catch a specific error/warning
* Python: every use of `pytest.raises()` and `pytest.warns()` in tests should pass argument `match` to catch a specific error/warning, and should catch a more specific exception type than "Exception"

## Approach

Do not try to fix all of these at once. Pull requests only changing 1 or a small number at a time are preferred.

Python:

* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_basic.py#L274 (#6887)
* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_basic.py#L281 (#6887)

* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/tests/python_package_test/test_engine.py#L2827 (#6925)

* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/R-package/tests/testthat/test_dataset.R#L49 (#6931)
* [x] https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/6437645c4a0c17046be59e4f57d09952e2e0185f/R-package/tests/testthat/test_dataset.R#L182-L184 (#6931)

## Notes

How to run the Python tests:

```shell
# build lib_lightgbm (just do this once)
cmake -B build -S .
cmake --build build --target _lightgbm -j4

# install Python package (do this every time you change Python code in the library)
sh build-python.sh install --precompile

# run tests
python tests/test_python_package
```

How to run the R tests:

```shell
sh build-cran-package.sh --no-build-vignettes
R CMD INSTALL ./lightgbm*.tar.gz
cd ./R-package/tests
Rscript testthat.R
```

For other questions on how to set up your development environment, see #6350 (and post questions there about the development process).
comments: @nicklamiller thanks so much for your help so far! There are just a few more of these left, could you help us finish this?

@jameslamb sure thing, all of these appear to be fixed except for the final `raises` in `test_dask.py`, which I've just opened a PR for. To help add the corr. PR in the issue [OP](https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/issues/6860#issue-2908975971) to the remaining unchecked `raises` by file: - `test_basic.py` - Remaining `raises`: https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/pull/6893 - `test_dask.py` - First two `raises`: https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/pull/6893 - Last `raises`: https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/pull/6955 - `test_sklearn.py` - All `raises`: https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/pull/6929 Also to enforce error messages when testing for errors in the future I believe we can: - Python package: Add [ruff's `PT011`](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/rules/pytest-raises-too-broad/) to the `pyproject.toml` file - Alternatively, we could enforce the entire [flake8-pytest-style (`PT`)](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/rules/#flake8-pytest-style-pt) collection of linters, though there are currently 27 related errors so if we want to enforce this we'd have to do a little work before updating the linting config for the sake of CI checks (please see "All PT Errors" below). Plus, some of these are naturally subjective styling so not sure if we necessarily want to enforce them. - R package: Keeping track of adding this linter to `lintr` in https://github.com/r-lib/lintr/issues/2870 - Doesn't currently exist for [`testthat` linters](https://lintr.r-lib.org/reference/pkg_testthat_linters.html) - If maintainers deem useful, I can add that in to `lintr` and afterwards update in this project and add that to the list of R linters we use So please let me know if you'd like me to make the immediate proposed change to the python linting config (adding `PT011`) and if so, if you'd like me to do it as part of this issue or open up a separate issue.

Oh great, thank you!!! I apologize, looks like I was not doing as good a job of keeping the list in the description up to date as I thought. I just updated all of those and approved  + merged #6955.

> _we could enforce the entire [flake8-pytest-style (PT)](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/rules/#flake8-pytest-style-pt) collection of linters_
> _..._
> _ let me know if you'd like me to make the immediate proposed change to the python linting config_

Thanks so much for the thorough explanation. I love the idea of introducing `ruff`'s `PT011` to help enforce this stuff, and I'd support just immediately doing that (no need to create a new issue).

Looks like it even caught one overly-broad exception that I missed in this issue:

https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/e7c6c4371b5d725902a09a80b4d6c36e432a4381/tests/python_package_test/test_dask.py#L1233

I'd support PRs (or even a single PR, if you'd prefer) that introduced `PT` in the list here:

https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/blob/e7c6c4371b5d725902a09a80b4d6c36e432a4381/python-package/pyproject.toml#L141

These look like some great suggestions... for example, only putting `with pytest.raises()` around the 1 statement that raises the exception is really helpful, and something @StrikerRUS has advised me on before. Would be great to enforce that automatically!

But please add the following to the `ignore` list

* "PT007 Wrong values type in `pytest.mark.parametrize` expected `list` of `tuple`"
  - *I do not really understand this one... a `tuple` is a little safer because it's immutable*
* "PT003 `scope='function'` is implied in `@pytest.fixture()`"
  - *I like being able to read the code and knowing it's a function-scoped fixture, not needing to remember what the default is*

> _I can add that in to lintr and afterwards update in this project and add that to the list of R linters we use_

Thanks for opening that `{lintr}` issue.

If that idea is accepted and implemented there, I'd support using it here in LightGBM. I understand and agree with some of the concerns @MichaelChirico raised there, but for `{lightgbm}` (where our `expect_error()` tests are mostly catching our own first-party error messages), I'd like this linter's help and I'd be willing to to pay the slight maintenance cost of `# nolint` comments on any `expect_error()` calls catching errors raised by other libraries.

Totally up to you if working on that in `{lintr}` interests you!

Thanks!

Yeah let's let #6959 close this issue. No need to create a new issue here for the `{lintr}` stuff, since that isn't even guaranteed to be merged... It would be ok with me if you just open a PR here in the future introducing the new linter(s) and bumping the version, similar to https://github.com/microsoft/LightGBM/pull/6471

issueDTO.title: Create Features Page
issueDTO.description:
Description:
We need a dedicated Features page that clearly outlines the key functionalities of the Notes App. This page will help users understand the purpose and capabilities of the app at a glance.

What to Include:
List and display the main features, such as:

Create, edit, and delete notes

Light and dark mode toggle

Organize notes by folders

Color-coded notes

Export notes as .txt or .pdf

Authentication and user profile

(Upcoming) Add images to notes

Note reminders and alerts (future scope)

Design Guidelines:
Use a clean and consistent layout

Follow the existing design system of the app (colors, typography, spacing)

Display features in card layout, grid, or a vertical list with section headings

Ensure responsiveness across screen sizes
comments: Hey @soumya813, can I work on this?
Hey @soumya813, can you define a little bit more about feature page means, how it will be, and what I need to add?

issueDTO.title: Add `TotalNetIn` and other new fields to `rueidiscompat.ClientInfo`
issueDTO.description:
https://github.com/redis/redis/pull/13944 CLIENT INFO and CLIENT LIST have the following new fields:
1. tot-net-in: total network bytes read from the client connection
2. tot-net-out: total network bytes sent to the client connection
3. tot-cmds: number of commands executed by the client connection

We should add `TotalNetIn`, `TotalNetOut`, and `TotalCmds` to `rueidiscompat.ClientInfo` and fill the corresponding values.

See: https://github.com/redis/go-redis/pull/3409/files#diff-4d7d1923693fc5ce892add2ea2907a744e77ea0b50c1939ccc5067cb48a466a3R5200-R5202.

issueDTO.title: cleanup/remove interfaces.js from src/backend/src/services/drivers
issueDTO.description: The `interfaces.js` is where driver interfaces were registered at the beginning, but this wasn't a good approach because it doesn't make it possible for outside modules to define new driver interfaces. Support for registering driver interfaces from other modules was added later, for example the `puter-chat-completion` definition in that file isn't used and the real `puter-chat-completion` interface is [defined by this service](https://github.com/HeyPuter/puter/blob/main/src/backend/src/modules/puterai/AIInterfaceService.js) (as it should be). Some of the definitions in `interface.js` are still in use and need to be migrated to the new registration mechanism. I think it's just `crud-q` and maybe also `puter-analytics`. Then, this file should be removed.
comments: Hey is it possible to be assigned to this issue?
Assigned. Let us know if you need help :)
Can you also assign me to this issue?
Hello, are you working on this issue with @ajavaid7111 ? They are currently assigned to this issue.
can i contibute to this issue
is it possible to be assigned to this issue?
Can i give it a try ? @KernelDeimos

issueDTO.title: [Feature] Make Infinistore Link Type Configurable
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Infinistore supports Ethernet and Infiniband, but LMCache hard-codes the link type to Ethernet when setting up its Infinistore connection. This limits the usefulness of the Infinistore backend.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like to add a configuration parameter (maybe `infinistore_link` or `infinistore_link_type`) that allows choosing Ethernet or Infiniband at runtime.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Currently I work around this by editing the hard-coded link type value. This is not a great solution for folks who are not building from source.

**Additional context**
I am happy to make this change if maintainers agree it should be made.
comments: Hi, thanks for raising it. I'd like to work on this issue.

issueDTO.title: Can Terraform be used to enable Fleet/Integrations Keep Policies Up to Date?
issueDTO.description:
As the Fleet documentation mentions some integrations are installed (and maybe managed) by Fleet and some or all of them have an option in the 'Settings' tab of the integration to Keep integration up to date automatically.  Other integrations do not have this capability and would be updated manually when a new version is available.
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/fleet/current/upgrade-integration.html#upgrade-integration-policies-automatically

Terraform providers offers an integration installation capability where an option for 'version' specifies a specific version.  This option is a type string.
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/elastic/elasticstack/latest/docs/resources/fleet_integration

Questions are:  1) Could an value of "latest" or some other string be used in place of a specific numbered version to 'enable' terraform to Keep the integration(s) up to date?  2)  Could the Fleet API with 'keepPoliciesUpToDate' option be used to set/enable all integrations across the board to be kept update to date automatically?  3)  Is it advisable to try this or would there be any known or unintended consequences that might occur thereby making it something not to do or attempt?

It seems that since some of the integrations have the keep up to date feature and some do not, that there is a reason that not all integrations already have this Fleet UI toggle button.
comments:
+1 - we just ran into a problem related the fleet integrations when upgrading our entire stack from 8.15 -> 8.18

I think because of the "auto update", the apm server integration got upgraded to 8.18 automatically, this broke our terraform state because it couldn't find the apm server integration 8.15.

We had to manipulate state to remove it, then found out that `terrafom import` is not supported for this resource type, so we had to manually go in kibana and delete the integration, so then terraform was able to proceed and create it.

This is really cumbersome
It's the first time we've ran into this because it's the first upgrade after we introduced terraform to manage our elastic stack.

Plus, I'm wondering if it's even worth to have the integrations controlled by terraform, because when you bump the version, terraform tries to remove the integration and add a new one, but this fails because you cannot remove integrations that have a policy assigned to it.

This really breaks the whole point of automating this.
As a paying customer, I'm really disappointed that the terraform provider just seem like an afterthought, and there is really no other good alternative to maintain a bunch of elastic/kibana internal resources through IaC

It is a reasonable question to be asked, if it does make sense to manage the fleet integrations with Terraform. We do it for one of our setups since roughly 9 months and there are some challenges attached to it. The main reason we still do it is, that it helps us to keep everything under control between the 3 deployments (dev, test, prod).

What we find challenging is to perform updates of the fleet integrations. We normally execute the update manually on dev and then "backport" the changes to Terraform by analyzing the differences in the execution plan. The main challenge there is rooted in the fact, that some of the properties (for example `vars`, if I recall correctly) are marked as sensitive in Terraform and therefore Terraform refuses to show the differences even if the property might not contain any sensitive value for some of the fleet integrations (where others actually do store sensitive values in this property). Since analyzing the differences in the JSON output of the Terraform plan became very painful (especially, since the values are JSON in JSON), we even built our own tool to assist with this (https://github.com/breml/tfreveal).

The bottom line is, that with the use of fleet integrations one faces the challange, that there are two different systems (Terraform and the install/update mechanism of Fleet), which change the state and therefore there is always drift, that one needs to handle in Terraform. Sofar we made it work, but compared with other systems, that we manage with Terraform, this is for sure one of the more painful ones.

repository.description: Terraform provider for Elastic Stack
repository.name: terraform-provider-elasticstack

summary.main: The main goal is to use Terraform to enable Fleet/Integrations Keep Policies Up to Date.

summary.attemptedFixes: The author has tried to update fleet integrations manually, but it is cumbersome and has caused issues. They have also built a tool to assist with analyzing the differences in the Terraform plan.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about using Terraform to enable Fleet/Integrations Keep Policies Up to Date. The question is whether a value of 'latest' or other string can be used to keep integrations up to date. The author has faced challenges in updating fleet integrations and is looking for a solution.
